Although I got take-out, the restaurant was nice and spacious inside. The ambiance was warm, serene, and inviting.
author: Mansi A.

description: Still my go-to locations for a nice white table cloth bo luc lac (shaken beef) and a wonderful place for an intimate dinner for 2 or a dinner party.  My Max Muscle on Polk friends met here for a holiday/end of 2014 dinner.  Altogether, we ordered quite a few dishes off the menu.  Rice noodle dishes, vermicelli dishes, veggie dishes, soup, beef and seafood dishes.  I got to try cha can (basa fish), which was delicious (and I highly recommend it).  Very memorable evening at a restaurant, which carries bittersweet memories of my first years in SF!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
What is this? Pho Tai for ants? It's gotta be at least... 3 times bigger!

A motto I live by: beware Asian cuisine in a predominantly non-Asian neighborhood. I broke from my own advice this time, and it only reinforced the truthiness of the statement ever so much more in my mind. I was hung over and in need of a fix and this was the only place that served pho in Russian Hill. Big mistake, tiny portions. Some other reviews in here say the pho is light and fragrant, I call that bland and unflavorful.

If you're craving Vietnamese, honestly just make the trek down to the TL. They'll fire skeet rockets of flavor to explode in your mouth hole for half the price and twice the portion. Maybe I'm just spoiled from living near Garden Grove for years, but connoisseurs stay away.

In summary, small portions, high prices, mediocre food, and average service. Only giving it 2 stars for location, which I probably shouldn't because that location could be used for something much better.
author: Mat K.

description: Delivery was fast both times I ordered from here! Ordered pretty much the same things both times and each time it was consistently  good! Cai Xanh - Chicken with Broccoli -  very similar to Xup Chan Soap and Goi Cuon - Spring rolls were a good size, made very well, not to many herbs for my taste and the peanut sauce was delicious!
author: Andrrs B.

description:
This place has become a take-out staple for my fiancè and I.  The food is very good and always ready for pickup within 20 min of ordering.

So far my favorite order is crispy chicken in a garlic sticky sauce with garlic noodles. One of my favorite take-out combos in recent memory.
author: Zack F.

description:
I love their Bo Luc Lac (shaken filet mignon cubes)!!!  Meat was soft and tasty and a bargain at $14 compared to what they charge at Slanted Door (http://www.yelp.com/biz/ZuhygpLHdwsELMWa3Nbymw) or Bong Su (http://www.yelp.com/biz/SRy_SJUSqF7lLs3zfQHqdw).  All their other dishes were great, but two orders of Shaking Beef with rice would be heavenly for me.  

Parking in this Russian Hill area on a weekend night is near impossible.  I drove around for 25 minutes with no success and ended up paying $15 for parking.
author: トモ T.

description:
One of the PHO places in SF!!! Can be a casual date night spot, especially on a rainy / cold day! 

Love their PHOs, usually get the Veggie PHO w Beef broth.

Their spring rolls are so fresh Yum ! 

Their lunch menu is great too , I recommend either the BBQ Beef or The Prawn & Scallop skewer dish (it's spicy).

They actually have a bar in the back so they serve alcohol too!

One of my fav places in the neighborhood !
author: Sepi N.

description:
I'm updating my review and taking away one star.

The man who takes phone orders sounds like he reallllly hates his job and therefore it projects over the phone that he doesn't really want to take your order.  If you hate your job that much, do something besides taking phone orders.
author: Mrs. N.

description: Nice restaurant for Vietnamese food. I had the beef coconut curry, chicken ginger and chow mein. Food is a little expensive. I would say $12 bucks a dish but it's worth it. As the ambiance is very good.
author: Mat U.

description:
This used to be one of our favorite restaurants and we'd frequent it on a regular basis. Unfortunately the last few times we've been extremely dissapointed. We have a fairly well behaved 2 year old and make sure to avoid impacting any other patrons meals. We even go early (dinner at 5pm) as to ensure that we aren't a nuisance. 

The staff and owners of the place have zero patience for children and have been incredibly rude on both of our last 2 visits.  The message conveyed has been very clear and we won't be going back. 

Definitely not a family friendly environment.
author: Dean C.

description:
This place seems so cute and is right in my neighborhood so gave it a try last night with two friends.  Got in shortly before 9pm without a reservation and enjoyed a great bottle of wine and some appetizers which were the highlight of the meal.  Our waitress kept pressing us for our dinner order without giving us much time to review.  She apparently got annoyed and sent in "the closer" who was the definition of rude.  He wanted our orders and he wanted them now.  Not even 5 minutes after they were placed our meals showed up.  We weren't even halfway through our apps.

It went downhill from there.  As we are eating our meals they started to close up the restaurant.  Music was turned off and they were on a mission to get every last guest out of there ASAP.  I finally asked what time they close and why the rush - apparently they close at 10pm (on a Friday which is ridiculous).  Had we know, we would have gone elsewhere.  

Easily the worst customer service I've experienced in SF.  The appetizers were great but the meals all looked like Chinese takeout.

Bottom line - not worth it.
author: Erika H.

description:
Stay away from this place at all costs. They just don't care about you or your order, and will rip you off in the process.

I ordered delivery on Friday night, and had one of the worst experiences I've had in a long time.

They told me it would take 45 mins - 1 hour for the food to arrive. After 1 and a half hours, I tried calling back to check in on the food. No one answered the phone. I kept on calling repeatedly for half an hour, when someone finally picked up the phone. They said the food hadn't gone out yet but "would be there right away."

When I asked why it took so long for them to send out my food, or even pick up the phone, they said that they were just too busy. So, beware, this restaurant thinks they're so busy that they don't actually have to serve you.

The food was also terribly overpriced. We ordered the beef and shrimp skewers, and we got such a small amount of food that it was ridiculous. The food is also very disappointing, you can do immensely better with Vietnamese food in SF. The Pho was average at best compared to anywhere else.
author: Artur O.

description:
Love this place. Going to side w/ other yelpers: Eat here instead of getting takeout, many of their dishes need to be eaten soon after they're prepared.  

The basa fish (Cha Ca) and the pho are both phonominal (sorry). For serious though, they're great eating. The fish is super flavorful (pholavorful? (sorry again)) and there's lots of of it. The pho is the best I've had in SF, their broth is outstanding. 

The imperial rolls are tasty (a little difficult to incorporate all the vegetable sides they give you though). The claypot chicken (Ga Kho) was quite good, the caramel sauce is real tasty.

Upscale but relaxed atmosphere. You could go on a nice date here or bring like 15 kids for a pho party, either would be fine. Service is quick and friendly.

I wanted to put another pho pun here, but I'm not gonna. You're welcome, Yelp.
author: Ryan D.

description: Walking into Asian restaurant in California could be hit or miss. This one is most definitely a hit, as then hit again because god damn was the food good, tastes of savory sauces, excellent preparation, and execution of cooking. The service was also very excellent. The egg rolls should be ordered twice because they are that crunchy and tasty. Do not miss this place.
author: Jay X.

description:
This is one of the most inventive, loveable fusion places on the planet. This restaurant makes no pretense of giving you "Vietnamese" but goes straight for the American palet by embracing the French influence on Vietnamese cuisine. The food is phenomenal, spiced, delicious, and truly showcases ingredients by complimenting them with great spices. 
The soup is great, the fried foods are light and airy. A great job in not letting the food get heavy.

In reading other reviews, I was a bit surprised. I all of the food that I tasted was exceptional, not too greasy or overdone. And the service was also prompt and friendly. The ambiance is lovely, and I had a wonderful time. Perhaps this is a place that is better suited to a quiet evening with the family/casual dinner with friends. In any case, it's the place that I can imagine engaging my friends and food with love.
author: Leah Q.

description:
We came here for its proximity to an event we were going to.  It's Vietnamese food, but it's more catered to an American crowd.

First off, in preparation for the night, we had Vietnamese coffees, which were dripped in the traditional way - hot or iced (dripped into a cup filled with condensed milk at the bottom).

Dishes: 
- Garlic noodles: good bite to the noodles, pretty garlicky, enough salt.  I liked it a lot, but for noodles, it was kind of pricey
- Ca kho: catfish in a spicy caramel-sauce served in a clay pot - it was only $12 but was a pretty small portion.  The sauce was good, but it had way too many bones in it
- Ga nuong: it's nice that all their chicken is white meat.  The grilled filets were flavorful, not too dry, served with romaine, good as a lighter option
- Bo xao dau hu: tofu stir fried with beef, shiitake mushrooms, just ok
- Com chien: pork and prawn fried rice - not too flavorful on its own, but good as a base for the sauce from the catfish and beef/tofu dish

Overall, I had hoped for more flavors and slightly larger dishes at this price point.  The location was convenient for where we needed to be, and they take reservations by phone.  

We had a party of 8, so gratuity was included.  They take credit cards, but it's a 2 card per table max.
author: Marilyn T.

description: Even though the service was super slow because they were short in staff and we had to wait 45 minutes, this food was some of the best Vietnamese food I've had anywhere including my mom's house :) Very authentic, appropriately French-influenced (a little lighter in flavor and fat and with some more refined sauces), and very fair portions. A fantastic dinner for 4 cost us only $60. For a nice dinner with nice ambience on a nice street in SF, I'd say that's more than fair. If you're looking for some traditional dishes, try the CA Kho (caramelized catfish in claypot), Canh Chua (tamarind lemongrass soup), Bo Luc Lac (sauteed filet mignon). That's exactly what we ordered and two hungry men and one voracious girl ate past our fill!
author: Marilynn L.

description:
I was a little disappointed with this place

my husband and I ordered delivery on a week night and it took about an hour(pretty standard). We had ordered garlic noodles, silver noodles with vegetables and their lemon grass soup (similar to a Tom Yum at a Thai Place).

The garlic noodles had garlic flavor but not a fresh garlic flavor. Nothing really shined through and all I was wishing for was a sauce! It was very dry. I'm not sure what all the other reviews had tasted but this was very bland.

The silver noodles were ok. Again, I was wishing for more of a sauce. I tasted a bit of ginger but it needed salt and acid. 

The best was the lemon grass soup. Had great heat and was very yummy on a cold SF night.

Nothing to rave about. 

Please note that if you are ordering delivery you will need to call in your order since they are not on Grubhub or Eat24 which can be a bit difficult when you can't pronounce some of the items on the menu

With tip it came out to $25
author: Whitney S.

description:
I usually head to the TL to get my Vietnamese fix but decided to give Aux Delices a try.  This is definitely pricier than the usual Vietnamese hole in the walls, but this is Polk Street so it's expected that it's more pricey.  We ordered:

Sampler Platter (Spring Rolls, Imperial Rolls, Steamed Dumplings) - this was my favorite dish of the night, loved everything about the items and it came with yummy peanut sauce and fish sauce.  This was my first time having steamed dumplings at a Vietnamese place and it reminded me of the the shrimp/ beef crepes at dim sum

Garlic Noodles - Standard 

Crispy Chicken (in spicy, sweet garlic sauce) - the batter and sauce was delicious but the chicken inside were tiny slices of overcooked chicken breast

Catfish Claypot - this was delicious as well

Overall, I would come back and order the sampler platter for sure!
author: Veronica N.

description:
I am hooked on Golden Deli in the SGV in Southern California and my standards are based on their deliciousness. That said, Aux Delices is a suitable substitute between visits to LA. It's not as delicious, the portions are smaller and it's more expensive but what can you do?

PHO: the broth is simple and good. The portions are not big and it's expensive for pho ($9). Not the best ever but for SF and for Russian Hill, it's pretty good. 

FRIED EGG ROLLS: you get 2. They're longer in size but still not a great value. They're crispy and tasty and the skin isn't too thick (which is a problem a lot of Vietnamese places in SF have) so it definitely hits the spot when a trip to LA is far away.

The black pepper filet mignon cubes are good too but very pricey for what you get. 
The noodle salads are tasty but nothing special.
author: K C.

description:
Crab with garlic noodles...game over.

Excellent crab.
author: Jeff R.

description:
Having been indoors all day, we decided to take a walk to Polk Street and up to Aux Delices Vietnamese Restaurant for a nice, early dinner tonight.  I've walked or driven by this place a ton of times, and am so happy we finally we came here tonight.  

My bf had his favorite Vietnamese dish, lemongrass bbq pork with Imperial rolls over noodles - he looked so happy as it was tasty, fresh and lovely.  I had the chicken noodle soup or Pho Ga - loved the fresh bean sprouts, basil and lime to sprinkle on top and the chicken, noodles and broth were perfection.  So comforting good on a cool San Francisco Friday evening.  

We had a nice window seat to enjoy the people watching back and forth on Polk Street.  The service was really nice and attentive, and the ambiance is pleasant and lightly romantic.  I would definitely come back for a nice, upscale Vietnamese dining experience at a great, affordable price.
author: Maile N.

description: This is my go-to place for pho!  Love it - both the chicken and rare beef. Other favorites are clay pot chicken (caramel sauce), crispy chicken and spring rolls. Used to eat at restaurant but now with 2 kids usually ordering delivery :)
author: Jamie S.

description: Good vibes. Nice place, super clean. Across the street from Loving Cup and Crunch. You can workout before and get desert after! Recommended: Steamed dumplings, clay-pot chicken, grilled steak and prawn skewers.
author: nate m.

description:
$9 bucks for Banh Xeo!!!!?? Are you kidding me??  
No, I'm not.  I think it was $8.95 for 1 piece & all I tasted was the over crisped batter and its oil.  We also ordered the Com Thit Nuong and that was ok.  It came with an order was watery fried rice.  I should've went with my instinct and ordered the Ca Kho.  I think I'm just spoiled by Vietnamese food in so cal because first of all- its really cheap and second of all- its delicious.

The other members of the party enjoyed their food though.
author: Thuy V.

description: Boss. Fucking. Food. Me & the bf always get delivery. I always get the tofu vermicelli. So good, I could eat it twice a day (and have, shhhhh). Bf gets the chicken and we both love the fresh rolls. Yum yum yum. Please give it a whirl. Delivery takes a while but it's accurate.
author: Miriah S.

description:
A girlfriend and I were walking down the street and we saw this place. We were looking for something light and decided to be adventurous and walk into a restaurant WITHOUT yelping! Yeah we were crazy!

I guess I've developed a keen sense for finding places in SF after all these years. Everything we had was great. We especially enjoyed the papaya salad. I went for the pho but I've gotten used to a special pho at another place (http://www.yelp.com/biz/jasmine-garden-san-francisco) which has a lemon broth- so the pho here tasted good but a little plain. Again my palate is now only faithful to the lemongrass pho. 

But overall a great find.
author: Komal B.

description: Delicious food in a cute setting. Imperial rolls are the best ever, Also loved their five spiced chicken and their garlic noodles. All in all it was a fantastic experience. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a new good Vietnamese restaurant!
author: Glenn C.

description:
Being away from home, I miss my mom's Vietnamese cooking the most. There's just a certain appeal and familiarity that you don't get with Vietnamese food elsewhere. Banh xeo, ca kho, canh chua - these are just some of the items I crave and yearn for while I'm miles away from home.

Luckily, Aux Delices is not far off from replicating the magic that is my mom's cooking. The food here is top-notched and I found myself devouring everything. Outside of pho, I don't eat Vietnamese food at restaurants very often, but here, I just had to give it a try. And trust me, the chefs at Aux Delices really know their stuff.

I would definitely recommend getting the ca kho (their catfish). You don't often find this item offered at Vietnamese restaurants, but it's delicious here. I also had the Bo Luc Lac (filet mignon cubes) and that was crazy good as well.

Seriously, if you're missing your mom's Vietnamese cooking, try Aux Delices. It may not be home itself, but it comes damn close.
author: Tom P.

description:
oOOoooo, this is one of the nicer viet places in SF.

a low-key date worthy, but also great for take-out!

I had a combo plate with imperial roll (YES. they are awesome. I'm been super into fried things recently .__. and this is def one of the TOP fried things I crave now), grilled pork and brown rice (er somewhat trying to be healthy after the roll) instead of fried rice.

Sister and friend had bun bowls. They both enjoyed it!

We also split a tom yum typa soup that I gulped down super quick.

mmmm yas
author: Alexis P.

description:
i love aux delices. I live about two blocks away so i've been coming here for about 3 years or so now? anytime i'm too lazy to make lunch I walk down here to get their mixed grill. a skewer of chicken, a skewer of beef, a skewer of grilled shrimp. plus two egg rolls! plus fish sauce. plus fried rice. NOT just any old fried rice. fried rice with like grilled onions it's sweet and salty and delicious. usually i eat half of the mixed grill for lunch and save the other half for another day and the leftovers are bomb. 

did i mention the fried rice isn't any old fried rice??! it's part crispy too!! the garlic noodles are lovely. their egg rolls aren't any regular egg rolls. it tastes like the cook took his time making it! it's really pretty inside too. with booths and dim lighting. 

but when in doubt, GET THEIR MIXED GRILL. it's greattttt.
author: Kayla O.

description: Excellent food but alas they are closed for lunch ALL the time now. Very annoying that they do not change this information. We drove there specially, parked and found them closed--after we had checked their hours online.
author: Valerie M.

description: Amazing Service and huge variety of vietnamese dishes the waitress was very helpful and very nice about the food great quality and taste like heaven definitely I will come back
author: Manuel M.

description: One of the best authentic Vietnamese restaurants in the city. Again last night with a party of 8, we shared delicious dish after dish. The staff is always helpful and accommodating. A real jewel on Polk st!
author: Tom F.

description:
My husband and I came here for dinner during a trip to SF. We chose it based on the good reviews and the fact that it looked livelier inside this restaurant than the Thai place across the street. 

Ordering - 
DH ordered the vermicelli salad, which is his go-to dish at Vietnamese restaurants and I got the spicy basil chicken dish. We usually share everything when eating out so I asked DH in front of the waiter if he wanted brown rice (to go with the chicken) and the waiter rudely interjected, "He's getting noodles." WTF. I didn't ask you, nosey!! If my husband and I wanna share plates that our business. You do the order taking, the cooking and the billing!
 That didn't sit well with me. After he left DH mentioned that he saw some fine print onthe menu with fees regarding spending minimums per person. I find that a little tacky for a restaurant. I understand if you offer free wifi, couches and other amenities and don't want peeps loitering around, but anyhoo, I digress.

Vermicelli Salad - 
Was sad. It had little sprinkles of crushed peanuts that were hard to differentiate from the little sprinkles of beef on top. The waiter told DH that the salad dressing was at the bottom and he had to toss the salad around to mix it with the noodles and everything else. Since when??? They're supposed to serve it in a dish on the side because the dressing naturally sinks! The noodles were hard and similar to cup of noodles style noodles. There were a few shavings of vegetables in the mix. It was pretty sad watching DH fiddle with that dish. 

Basil Chicken - 
Can't complain. The dish had basil and chicken and some spice, but not much else. I was glad we were able to get our protein from somewhere. 

Service - 
Our waiter looked like he hated life. 

Overall - 
We felt duped and it was the worst meal experience of our trip. The first place we ate when we got back home was our fav place to have pho and bahn mi, which reminds me ... I have to review them! :)
author: Jack A.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by Aux Delices.  Service and food were both good.  We started with the appetizer sampler which came with 2 each of dumplings, summer rolls, and spring rolls.  All were good.  Although fried, the spring roll was surprisingly light (not greasy) and crispy.  I was craving pho and was not disappointed.  The soup was light and citrusy and paired nicely with the chewy noodles.  I wish NY had find soup like this.  *sigh*
author: Masumi T.

description: Mediocre and too expensive for what you're getting. Also, the food isn't Vietnamese so much as it's unspecified westernized asian food. Won't be returning.
author: Simcha K.

description:
I was on vacation with my father and while wrapping up our time in San Francisco we were looking for a place to have lunch. Since we had not had Vietnamese yet, we walked into Aux Delices with high expectations, since my father had used to live in San Francisco. As soon as we walked in we immediately you noticed how good the restaurant smelled. We eventually decided on me getting the beef noodle salad, which was incredible. The sweetness of the sauce and beef, combined with the cucumber and lettuce just made for a fantastic meal that I will remember for a while. 
Not only that, but the rice soup that everyone is served before their meal was a good precursor to the upcoming meal. In fact, the meal was so good, my father and I argued over which one was better, mine or his.
author: Nick S.

description: This restaurant was AWESOME.  The first good sign was the wait once we got there (8:30 on a Saturday night).  10-15 minutes and they were quick to get us seated and had great recommendations.  Whatever you do, get #27.  It's a pork/shrimp sautee in a caramel sauce and it is by far the greatest flavor in the history of ever.  We also got #43 which was a flank steak with a garlicky sauce and peanuts and it was delicious also.  We started with the sampler platter and I had the sparkling lemonade.  All were great!  At the end of the meal, our bill was under $45.  That is pretty dang good for San Fran prices, and this is coming from a South Carolina girl.  If you're thinking about it.. Just do it.  You won't be sorry.
author: Laura H.

description:
Giving Aux Delices 5-stars, even though 99% of the time, I've only ordered delivery or takeout, simply because it's close to my house.  I eat here at least 2x per week.  Fantastic and very quick service.  Delivery seldom takes more than 30-40 minutes and you can order online. 

Some of my favorites on the menu:

Chicken Pho: perfect amount of spice and flavor.  This is an ideal dish for a cold night....or if you have a cold yourself!

Thit Nuong: Charbroiled Pork Slices appetizer: the pork is so lean and delicious with lettuce, rice noodles, sauce and other accompaniments to wrap/dip in

Imperial Rolls: ultimate fried roll goodness, cut into small pieces for more lettuce wrapping & dipping.  I'd recommend not ordering this at the same time as the Thit Nuong, because the dishes are very similar.  But OH so delicious!

Bun - Vermicelli Noodle Salads: light, spicy and delicious.  Definitely one of the healthier options on the menu if you're looking to be "good"

Cai Xanh Xao: ginger and garlic sauteed chicken with broccoli.  Perfect with brown rice.

Bo Va Tom Lui: grilled steak & prawn skewers

 
Highly recommended!
author: Jennica S.

description: worse pho broth ever, heavily watered down with no taste whatsoever.  Save your money a drink toilet water you will be better off.  Not sure how this piece of dog shit vietnamese place stays in business
author: Mr. P.

description:
Loved this place!  It was recommended to us by a friend so we went out of our way to find it after a very long day of walking around SF......and boy are we glad we did!

The prices were very reasonable, the food came quickly and the amount we ate was too much.  But we couldn't stop ourselves!

If only we lived in SF, we'd eat here a lot.  I expect it'd be cold by the time we had it shipped to the East Coast though....

Eat here....do it!!!!
author: Zoë M.

description:
The bowl of porridge before the entree is SO GOOD. (Yes, I was pretty hungry at the time. But it was yummy Asian-style porridge.)

The imperial rolls had a strange flowery? flavor to them. Not sure I'd get those again. The bbq pork was excellent, and the veggies in the noodle salad were super fresh. The sauce was good and not too strong. Also, MEGA POINTS for throwing in a handful of scallions. I just wish they hadn't hidden it under the pork. I didn't find them until I was 3/4 of the way through the bowl!
author: Lady V.

description:
5 stars for one of my (if not my) favorite restaurant in the city.  LOVE the garlic noodles and clay pot beef curry.  

Awesome family that owns and operates the restaurant, too!
author: Luke W.

description:
I travel alone on business and can basically eat wherever I desire.
When staying in San Francisco Aux Delices is always at the top of my list.
Chris, his family and staff make me feel extra welcome and at home. Prior to my recent trips to Vietnam Chis has given me insight and tips on what to do and see in his homeland. 
The food is the best I've had. I only wish I lived closer...
author: Rick W.

description:
Is another 5-star review for this joint redundant?

Well, my SO regularly demands (craves?) their crab glass noodles....and for good reason!
author: Droo G.

description:
Have ordered delivery from them 3x to Nob Hill.

The Bun with egg roll and meat was delicious all 3x. The porridge was good too, a friend had the vegetarian Bun and liked except for the sauce.

Only complaint: One time the Prawn soup I ordered had 3 tiny shrimp in it and seemed to be all broth. Maybe it was just a fluke though. I like the place and will keep ordering while here for work. Thanks!
author: Milla G.

description:
The food is ok, but the service was terrible.  Maybe we just got unlucky and got a particularly grumpy / unhelpful waiter, but he just seemed to really not even be trying to pretend to be helpful or friendly or any of the usual things you'd expect.   It felt like he was annoyed any time we asked for anything (really basic things, like a slice of lemon, and some plum sauce - I was just trying to add *some* flavor to the soup I got), which just really ruins the dining experience if you feel like you don't want to "bother" your waiter.   

The final straw for me was that when ordering I'd asked if I could get some mint or basil with my noodle soup, and he said they didn't have any (which I thought was very weird to not have any in a restaurant that does Vietnamese noodle soups.  my fiance thought maybe this was because they're "French-Vietnamese" style.  me: "oh, so they must be going for "French-style" service as well!")
Then, after we were done, I saw another table someone got a noodle soup and there was a plate on the side with the standard add-ons - bean sprouts, mint, basil, etc!!!    I couldn't believe it!!    Either he was lying because he didn't feel like getting it or there was a misunderstanding / language barrier.... but if you work in a restaurant and don't know "mint" and "basil", then you probably shouldn't be a waiter taking customers' orders!
author: S. M.

description:
I have yet to dine in at this place but their take out service is great. 
One time I ordered online and it told me the exact time it would be ready: 7:21 pm. They were accurate to the minute.
The other time I just walked in and ordered and it only took them about 6 minutes. 

The Beef Satay noodles are tasty and I really like them because they're unlike a lot of other vietnamese food. They have a little kick to them so be ready. 
The garlic butter chicken is great too but I have yet to figure out why the little piece of chicken is $12? 

I would definitely recommend, especially if you get home late or just want a quick, tasty meal. Go to Aux Delices!
author: Allie E.

description: Gourmet Vietnamese food!! Spicy papaya salad,, catfish in clay pot, and beef in an iron pot were all delicious. Highly recommended restaurant.
author: Charles C.

description: My boyfriend and I were going to go across the street to Lemongrass but decided to try something different and I'm so happy we did. I had the Spicy Lemongrass soup with noodles added and it delicious. My boyfriend was shocked I wasn't adding my usual heavy squirts of Sriracha and hoisin and I was equally as surprised. It was perfect. He had the chicken Chow Mien and also said it was great. Service was good. Couldn't have asked for a better night.
author: Maggie S.

description:
My favorite neighborhood Vietnamese. I would recommend eating here in person rather than ordering delivery or doing take-out. Why sacrifice taste for a little bit more convenience? The food is fresh and best eaten immediately. 

I've never been disappointed with my order and it's my reliable go-to for affordable yummy food when I have guests in town.  Some of my favorites include the Chao Tom (shrimp and sugar cane summer rolls), crispy chicken, beef and shrimp skewers, catfish in clay pot, and the Bo Luc Lac (shaken beef cubes over lettuce). 

The family that owns the place is always friendly and remembers what I order. I don't think I come here that much!
author: Stephanie F.

description: Parking is a bitch here.  The food portions are small for the price you pay.   I am still a fan of bodega bistro for french viet food.
author: Fatty A.

description: Fantastic!  I got take-out the other night, and had the Mi Toi Garlic Noodles and the Bo Xao Dau Hu (Beef with Tofu and Mushrooms).  The noodles were great, although a bit boring until I mixed them with the beef.  Then it was perfect - I just couldn't get enough of those mushrooms!  I would also say it's a bit on the expensive side, but you do get a generous portion.
author: Rachel A.

description: Great service, and amazing place to get some pho on a cool San Francisco day. Haven't explored many of their menu items but I'm sure they would not disappoint !
author: Rachel M.

description:
This is where I go for comfort food. It's fast, it's delicious, and the price is RIGHT!

I love coming here on a cooler night (most nights in SF) and grab a bowl of their beef noodle soup, their chicken congee or their stir fried satay beef noodles. 

The beef noodle soup (the pho) is not too overpowering or salty but just the perfect amount of flavor you would expect from a bowl of pho. If you are a pho purist, you may not love this place but I like it for its convenience and flavor. 

The chicken congee is how my mom would make it - comforting, subtly flavored with a touch of ginger to warm you up. It is the chicken soup for my soul and I love a nice hot bowl when I'm craving comfort food.

The beef satay noodles packs a punch and just the right amount of satay flavor. If I'm feeling *mildly* adventurous I would go for it and it warms you up with a slight kick (but not too spicy for wimps like me)

Finally, I should also add a shoutout to the bun cunh, the steamed pork dumplings. These aren't your typical pork dumplings but delicate rice paper filled with minced pork and mushrooms. They're not much to look at but once you add a little bit of their fried shallots with the fish dipping sauce, your tastebuds will thank you profusely.
author: Karen K.

description: I had the stomach flu for a week. First thing I attempted to eat was porridge which I ordered from Aux Delices. Chicken porridge just like mom makes. Super yummy. Closest thing and only decent Vietnamese food on Polk.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
++ Great Service: Party of two in and out in 35 minutes despite dinner time rush.

++ Fresh ingredients: Steamed fresh spring rolls were delicious, fresh and flavorful. Green salad had crunchy veggies. 

-- Negatives: the Banh Xeo came off a bit greasy... delicious but greasy. And some of the entrees were a tad expensive for what they were. 

The sign outside gives a 'cheap' curb appeal, but is made up for by a cozy and vibrant environment inside. All in all, a great but potentially overlooked Vietnamese gem in Russian Hill.
author: Anne E.

description: I've tried many items on the menu and Aux Delices never lets me down!! Excellent quality food, a good value - it's family owned & operated; service is always prompt, courteous & helpful. It's the best Vietnamese restaurant in SF!
author: D H.

description:
Great atmosphere for a neighborhood Vietnamese spot.  Very good food, not the best I've ever had but I will definitely go back!  

The reason my rating is not higher is that we had a few unfriendly experiences with the waiters.  They were very rushed and might have been understaffed but I found them to be a bit rude.  

I will recommend this place to friends regardless of the service experience.  : )
author: Mara M.

description:
BEST PLACE FOR DELIVERY. EVER.

Who says you need to sacrifice food quality for the convenience of food delivered straight to your door?? I found Aux Delices on Yelp on a lazy Sunday night looking for delivery that wasn't pizza, Chinese or Thai. Ended up ordering exactly what the reviews directed:

16b - Garlic Noodles: The garlic flavor was pretty light. Definitely not as good as Thanh Long or PPQ but went well as a carb for the other dishes.
50 - Filet Mignon Cubes: Yum! I don't know how they cook this but the dish wasn't heavy at all the the meat perfectly cooked! 
54 - White Fish with Dill: Excellent flavor! Came with lettuce and this great sauce so I figure you wrap it up but it tasted really good with rice too.

The menu on the website is from 2006 but I figure it's still accurate b/c the numbers are all the same:
http://www.auxdelicessf.com/images/aux_menu06_small.pdf

Yes, yes...the prices are a little steep but I would say it's definitely worth it for a legit delivery meal. Highly recommended!!
author: Christina L.

description: This place is great.  I tried the garlic noodles and the crispy chicken.  The garlic noodles could use some veggies or something in it. It's just noodles in a sauce.  The Crispy Chicken was REALLY good. The sauce is delish!
author: Megan C.

description:
I've come to realize that although it's always got room for you during dinner (a bad sign, actually) and though I like the dining room, the quality of food is near bad.  Good enough to eat if you order certain dishes, but never something you'll crave.  This is the spot if you can't decide where to eat when you don't want to pay much for a dinner but need a spot at last minute. Honestly I've been here 10+ times and I wouldn't miss it if I never went back

I think the reason I finally woke up was because 1) I moved away from this location so I have other choices with accessibility   2) I ate at Jasmine Garden in Castro.. which brought me back to my senses, as their spring roll actually TASTED good and was much better quality.
author: Hannah W.

description:
Came in here to have a quick (tasty) bit to eat. He had been here before and swore that this place was the best Vietnamese restaurant in town. He was right.

The service was good and the food was nothing short of amazing. You have to get the Ga Chua Ngot (Garlic Chicken).
author: Yoni D.

description: They have PHO here. You can get it in small, medium, and large. I really enjoy it. The place is more of an upscale Vietnamese place. I think the medium is perfect size. The imperial rolls are soooo good. Great Pho tho!
author: Jess O.

description:
I am rarely compelled to write a bad review.  I have been ordering delivery from here for years but it is getting quite tedious.  Owners take note.

Delivery Area:
    Delivery within one mile radius. Please call to confirm order.There's a minimum of ten percent service for driver. If not given will be added.
Delivery Minimum:
    $20.00

Forty five minute wait.

Hi I would like to order a delivery.

Server ~ What is your address?  What would you like.

Apple ~ I would like one large order of pho and one order of fresh rolls.

Server ~ There is a twenty dollar minimum.

Apple ~ What is my order total?

Server ~ 17 dollars

Apple ~ What is the delivery charge.

Server ~ It is twenty dollar minimum.  Hold please.

Apple ~ Can you simply charge me twenty dollars?

Server ~ Do you want to order something?

Apple ~ Fine.  I will have a bottle of water.


Twenty dollar delivery minimum for Vietamese food?  I think not.  Ten percent service charge?  The dearth of quality delivery spots in SF and the surcharges assumed is starting to get tiresome.  I know this is not NYC, but we San Franciscans should start demanding better service and quality of life.  First order of business!  Delivery!

I would think for repeat customers they could accommodate a more lenient delivery policy.  I simply cannot eat that much food and it does not taste good the next day.  While restaurants want to cover delivery costs, they may consider that they will lose business with stringent policies like this.

Food four stars.  Delivery service two stars.
author: apple r.

description: Amazing tamarind base soup. Kind of quiet but the perfect accompaniment for great conversation. Will return.
author: Vatche A.

description:
I HAVE to update.

Having lived in the 'hood for nigh four years, now I feel well qualified to comment on this place.  Especially as I eat her 1-2 times a WEEK.  Best pho in the city.  Ate here with my friend, Cannon, again tonight and everything was terrific.  I had the chicken with garlic and onions.  Or, "#32" as I affectionately called it.  Cannon orders this dish once or twice a week, which is why I strayed from MY usual chicken pho.  And it was great.

So, while we mused on the nature of love and loss and Burning Man, we slopped up delicious Vietnamese and good wine at a fair price.

And the staff is top notch--how DO they remember me...?
author: Scott W.

description:
I was having a down day because of an on-coming summer cold, and needed some pho stat. This may not be the most authentic pho I've ever tried, but it was pretty damn good.  I was lucky enough to go in mid-afternoon, so the prep was quick and I was able to bring home the goods  within 10 minutes of ordering.  It was also not overly expensive- typical SF prices, definitely less for anything else in Russian Hill.  

I ordered the Pho Ga and thought that the broth was pretty good (not over or under flavored, a bit salty for my taste but I'm a chronic under-salter...), and hit the spot for when I needed it.  I will definitely be back to try more things on the menu.
author: Maija W.

description: Boyfriend HAD to have some Pho on a Sunday evening and nearly everything good was closed. So here we are. Clean and delicious. Also not located in the scarier Tenderloin area where most of the pho places are.
author: Louise R.

description: Incredible beef pho and sticky garlic chicken!
author: D S.

description: Caramel salmon in the clay pot was delicious and went well with brown rice.  Grilled pork vermicelli noodles were good, too.
author: Jared S.

description: 5 stars for authentic Vietnamese food, friendly service and warm atmosphere.  Every dish was a big hit.
author: Lon T.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, in fact I was excited to try it out based on the great reviews. Unfortunately I was completely let down. 

My husband and I had Pho, he had the chicken, I had the beef, and we shared an order of the Imperial Rolls. Bland, Bland, Bland! There was no flavor to the broth at all, the meat portions in the pho were minimal and it was just kind of sad. The imperial rolls were sticky/stale rather than crunchy as they are typically served. We also requested a side of Hanh Dam (pickled onions) and were told that next time the onions would be $1, to which we offered to pay for immediately (she didn't accept, but repeated the next time comment) - I don't ever mind paying for a side - but why put it THAT way? 

Unfortunately I don't see us returning to Aux Delices again, it may be around the corner, but I think it's worth it to make the trip to the places that deliver the right flavors. 

Hopefully your experience is better. :)
author: Hedy L.

description:
Hands down my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in Russian Hill, and possibly SF.

As far as I can tell the management has always been the same, and the servers are phenomenal. I must recommend the garlic chicken, and the pork & prawns in the clay terra-cotta pot with caramelized onions, incredible!

One time as a joke a few buddies and I ordered a bottle of wine for a table of girls and the server played along with it and was very humorous. I love Aux Delices.
author: Jason M.

description:
Hands down the Fanciest Vietnamese restaurant I have ever been to, but food taste was just OK. It's not bad, but not spectacular, the garlic noodles could use a lot more garlic. Portions are pretty small, 1 person can definitely do with 2 dishes. We ordered family style 6 dishes and every plate was wiped clean, including the rice, not because it was oh-so-good, but because we were oh-so-hungry. 

Was kind of turned off by the service. We had a party of 6 and reservations for 8pm, 2 of us got there early and they refused to seat us without the entire party, even though the whole place was empty except for 4 diners. So we asked for a table for 2, that was fine, just moved our stuff over to the big table when everyone else arrived. Now they have to clean 2 tables, how dumb...
author: Claudia Z.

description:
What's not to like???

They deliver if you're lazy or wanting to be incognito.

The restaurant is very comfortable, clean, warm-feeling, and pleasant.

Service is great for a place like this.

Shaking beef, lemongrass chicken, pho soup, steak salad are all my go-to's and are incredibly tasty.  

A terrific neighborhood joint that will hopefully never be taken over by the hipsters.
author: Glenn F.

description: Caters to a more American crowd.. but the pho was good and not too oily. I'd go again.
author: Amy L.

description:
So, what can bring my typing fingers out of yelp retirement? Aux Delice! Yummy, delicious, fresh, tasty are all words that I would use to describe this place. 

So, on our menu, we had:

Imperial Rolls- crispy, flavorful. 
Vietnamese Crepe - crispy shell stuffed with shrimp, pork, fish cake, sprouts
Shredded Papaya Salad - gingery goodness
Grilled Pork - wrap those suckers in a lettuce leaf, some noodles, sambal sauce....

Yes, we were piglets. And, we all agreed we were stuffed after the appetizers, but then came our entrees:

Garlic noodles - light and not too heavy.  Freshly chopped scallions added texture. 
Sheking Beef - give me a bucket of that any day. Sweet and salty and so tender. 
Crispy Chicken - sweet and sour and crispy deliciousness. It gives the crispy chicken wings at San Tun a run for their money. 

I will not try to lie and say that we did not polish off every morsel on those plates, uh, cause we did.

We also tried their delicious desserts (don't judge me, I had a salad for lunch!). 

Coconut creme brulee with passion fruit sorbet
Warm flourless cupcake with cinnamon sorbet. 

Service and atmosphere excellent.

Parking in that area can be a bit tricky, but be patient, cause it is worth it!
author: Mashi M.

description:
BEST VIETNAMESE IN THE CITY! Even though I mispronounce Aux Delices a zillion times knowing French, (embarrassing I know) this restaurant is still fantastic. I have been eating here since I moved to SF and it's become my kitchen extension only having to walk 0.1 mi to pick up food or eat there. 

The family who owns this restaurant are the nicest people. The prices, service, and food is great. Try the Bun with imperial rolls, Garlic Noodles, Short Ribs, Ga Kho clay pot chicken, for dessert coconut ice cream or the flourless chocoalte cake. Solid spot on Polk for any day of the week and I don't know what they add to their water, but it's magical. Make sure to ask for Christine!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Really like this place ;) Price reasonable and food is tasty, I had the grilled Pork & Imperial rolls with fried rice, it was very good! Service fast .
Will definitely come back !
author: Ornella G.

description: Good food across the board and nice relaxing ambiance.  Its my favorite Vietname place in the neighborhood.  Take out is quick and reliable too.
author: Todd F.

description:
Came here for late night pho with my friend. It was so rainy and cold and only hot soup would help. They are open till 10 p.m.

We got there at 9:25 p.m.

They didn't flinch at all that we were there so close to closing time. 

The spring rolls were fresh. The pho (I ordered the large as I wasn't sure of sizing). It was the perfect amount as it is comparable to the small at my regular place, and it was delicious.

They didn't rush us to eat or leave as we were the second to the last table.

I will definitely go back as it is clean, in a good neighborhood, friendly service and great quality.
author: Desiree P.

description:
REVIEW FOR TAKE-OUT ONLY

I ordered a large beef pho to go. The were 2 slices of beef! wah??? No cutlery or napkins of any kind either :( Veggies and noodles were good. The place was busy, so seems like a good sit-in restaurant.
author: Roxana G.

description:
I came here this past weekend and ended up ordering pho. I had to pay a $3 premium ($9 / bowl) to get a bowl of pho here. Basically one of the cooks decided to go spray happy with fish sauce in my soup. Ew, bleh. I love fish sauce, but there's a time and place for that, and the time and place is never in my bowl of soup. 

I didn't taste anything else, but none of my friends seemed particularly excited about their food either and a lot of it went untouched. I will say it had more "ambience" and looked cleaner than a lot of vietnamese restaurants, but I'm willing to give up some cleanliness for some better food.
author: Grace Y.

description: Excellent food and excellent service! Really liked the atmosphere as well. Highly recommended.
author: Tim A.

description:
**3.5 Stars

A solid neighborhood spot.   Reasonable prices, tons of options, very friendly service.  I'd definitely come back , or order in.

The serving sizes were more than enough for two, with some left over.

We ordered spring rolls, non - fried, garlic noodles and a beef with tofu dish.  All were quite good.  None destined to become my favorite, but I'm sure I'll find it.

It's one of those places that you can change up your order every time and not be disappointed.
author: brandie y.

description:
I would say 3.5. Was looking for a Vietnamese spot in the hood' and decided to try this place out. 
Ordered: 
Pho- so-so, have had better at cheaper spots 
Bun Cha Gio- delicious fried imperial rolls over thin rice noodles, shredded lettuce, cucumber, bean sprouts and ground peanuts...enjoyed this dish after adding more flavor with lemon and soy sauce, would go back to re-order..
Atmosphere:
Cozy booths, nice service, good location on Polk St...
author: Mahsa K.

description:
Haven't had a negative experience here yet, and I come here weekly.

Fantastic Vietnamese fusion food with the option of more traditional pho-type entrees as well. 

Friendly, attentive service. Affordable prices. Perfect for a quick bite after work, a group, or even a date! 

Highly recommend the garlic noodles (made extra spicy of course!) The chow mein is good, but I would advise against ordering it, since it's not a specialty. Try the veggie curry, for an interesting blend of curry powder and cocnut milk, filled with a variety of fresh and tasty vegetables. 

Go check it out!
author: Meghana D.

description:
--Decent ambiance (not a hole in the wall by any means)
--Courteous wait staff
--Pretty cheap prices
--All the dishes are delicious!

I can't even remember what I had here -- a fish dish, a pork dish, a soup dish.... everything was good.

Definitely solid if you're looking for a last minute place to go on a Friday night like us.... no wait!
author: Jeanne C.

description: My friend and I are both experiencing... digestive problems... after eating here together.  I thought everything tasted OK and even left a 3 star review earlier but now that my body's had a chance to digest everything I don't feel so good and there's a chance it could be from here.  The food tasted fine at the time (shaking beef, chicken with lemongrass, imperial rolls, garlic noodles)...
author: Alias A.

description: Depending on what you get here, it can be either expensive or reasonable priced. I definitely wouldn't say it is cheap. I get the chicken chow mein for about $9 and it's a good portion for one person with good flavor. The noodles are cooked really well. Other dishes can be a bit more expensive and smaller portion sized. Overall pretty good food.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Aux Delices is wonderful and delicious!

We settled into one of their cozy booths and ordered the following: vegetarian banh chua (a tamarind-flavored soup that does an excellent job of combining sweet, hot, spicy and sour flavors), cha gio - imperial rolls (fried to perfection and served with all the traditional accompaniments- lettuce, herbs, etc.), garlic noodles and caramel salmon (these final two selections are the perfect complement to one another). 

The service was superb, the food even better- I am glad this place is so close to home!
author: Miriam W.

description:
I'd give this 3.5 stars.  Had an early dinner on friday.  The place was pretty empty but the decor is a little romantic, a lot more clean, and sweet.  My friend and I both ordered the rice noodle salad.  Mine with chicken, hers with pork & imperial roll combo.

I found the chicken rice noodle salad flavorful without being too sweet or too salty.  It was refreshingly light tasting yet hearty enough to fill me up.  Filled with lettuce, bean sprouts, chicken, rice noodles, and a light sauce, I did need to add a little siracha for kick.  The imperial roll was crispy and yummy.  I also ordered the Vietnamese Coffee which I wished I hadn't.  It was a drip coffee that you mix with condensed milk and pour over ice yourself.  It was way, and I mean, WAY too bitter for me.  I felt like I added a cup of condensed milk and still felt it was bitter.  Plus it kept me awake the whole night.  I think others will like it if they like their coffee strong which I obviously don't.

The price is more on the expensive side for Vietnamese food ($10 - 14)but you are paying for the ambiance and clean looking plates.

I would be back to try other dishes.
author: C A.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by the meal I had here.  I ordered the spicy green papaya salad and the beef satay.  Both exceeded my expectations.  Although the food was very good - the service was just okay.  They waited about 10-15 minutes before coming over to the table and taking our drink orders.  They also forgot to place one of the food orders in our party entirely, which sent the server into a bit of a panic (and caused us to have to wait a while for everyone to have their food).  But we had a fairly large group, so I know these things happen.  Excited to check it out again with a smaller party sometime soon.
author: Riley D.

description:
I'm normally pretty picky about eating Vietnamese food out; I'm Vietnamese and am generally wary of "fusion" Vietnamese food and upscale Vietnamese restaurants because the food is usually less authentic, less tasty, and overpriced. I decided to check out Aux Delices because my boyfriend and I were craving Vietnamese food and didn't want to go to a hole-in-the-wall place for dining in.

Aux Delices is very charming and upscale, but still had touches of Vietnamese authenticity that I appreciated (the art and music mostly). The food was not very authentically Vietnamese, but Aux Delices is marketed as a more French-inspired Vietnamese restaurant, which I think is an accurate description.

The food was pretty good; I especially liked the caramel fish. In general though, everything was way overpriced (you can find most of these dishes in a hole-in-the wall Vietnamese restaurant for $5-$8 each, as opposed to $15). You're paying for the nice ambience and dining experience when you eat here.

Also, as a general tip about Vietnamese food -- if you want pho, don't go to a fancy restaurant like Aux Delices. You're better off going to a cheap pho restaurant, where pho is their main dish. There's a lot more variety and it's significantly cheaper.
author: Jackie C.

description: This is an OK Vietnamese restaurant. I tried their imperial roll as appetizer. For main dish, I tried the crispy chicken, they were both very greasy, and I was not impressed with the quality. The ambiance is OK, but for the price you pay, the quality can be improved.
author: Sasan A.

description: I spent a little while scalping reviews for vegetarian pho in Pac Heights, and I stumbled upon this gem! Fresh flavors and not overly salty, this upscale decor Vietnamese restaurant had the dishes out as fast as any other pho restaurant I've visited.
author: Florence D.

description:
I have always wondered about this randomly situated Vietnamese restaurant in Russian Hill. I finally ventured in to try. Nice to see lots of tables taken on hump day. Good sign.

We were greeted by friendly owners and seated at a table. Perusing the menu #54 Cha Ca ($14) (translation Grilled Bass) caught our attention. Fillets of bass is served in a hot cast iron skillet with fresh dill, green onions and red onions. Separately, a plate of rice noodles, lettuce and sauce accompanies the fish for you to make little wraps or your choice of throwing all items into the skillet to mix and enjoy. It was different from what we usually get in Vietnamese restaurants so a nice change.

We also ordered something familiar - Com Cha Gio Thit Nuong ($10) or Grilled Pork & Imperial rolls with fried rice. Pretty basic, but grilled seasoned pork is always tasty.

Overall friendly family-esque atmosphere. Smiling service. A nice authentic find for this part of the neighborhood.
author: Cindy W.

description: Great local Vietnamese place. The food is really good and there is rarely a wait. We often get takeout pho from here which is always very good. However, the decor is a bit old school. I think if they made the place trendier they'd get a lot more business.
author: Limor B.

description:
I met my friend TL for lunch today and was craving pho. Since I vowed to never return to the place on Lombard...i figured our only option was Irving St...TL suggested Aux Delices. I had to keep from rolling my eyes because after all..the dude rarely gets out of the 94123.
Aux Delices has been on Polk St as long as I've lived in the city..but I never had any desire to try it. I guess I just assumed that the Vietnamese places in Russian Hill couldn't be that good.
To my delight..Aux Delices not only hit the spot..I also got to  try some new dishes I hadn't tried before. 

We had the imperial roll for app as well as a mouth watering pork dumpling dish...
The waitress suggested that I try the pork and shrimp noodle soup rather than going for the usual pho...The pork and shrimp tasted really fresh. I left with a happy tummy...okay..perhaps overly stuffed..but happy...
author: Mimi T.

description: This place really hits only high notes on multiple levels.  Not only is the food amazing, but the decor is on point.  The atmosphere is also very comfortable, but my normal routine is getting the Pho for takeout at least once a week!.........It may be the best in the city.
author: P R.

description:
Went here the other night with my mother and a friend. My mom wanted to go somewhere in the city that was nice, not too expensive, and that would get her United air miles. She sent me a list of about 200 restaurants to choose from. The only stipulation was that she didn't want to go to a Japanese restaurant. That narrowed the list down to about 100 to choose from but what a chore it was. I finally decided upon Aux Delices based upon the yelp reviews. 

Finding the place was easy, but finding parking in the neighborhood definitely was not. After about 15 minutes of circling the block in larger and larger circles, I finally found a place about 5 blocks away and one of those blocks was VERY steep, especially in the pouring rain. Nevertheless, we arrived just in time for our 8:00 reservation.

The restaurant was rather small, but with nice decor. Service was a little slow, even though we were quickly seated in a nice booth. They had a large menu and it took a while to narrow down our choices. On a side note, I did find it rather funny that there were about 6 menu items listed under Pork, and 3 of those choices were beef. Beef was also listed under Beef.

We decided on the spring rolls for appetizers. Although they tasted quite fresh, the prawns were somewhat lacking in taste and the peanut sauce was a little thin. I've had better. 

The main dishes were what made this restaurant stand out. We shared the garlic noodles with chicken, prawn skewers, and grilled pork with fried rice. The noodles were intensely garlicky and oh so good. The grilled pork was perfectly seasoned, and there was enough for each of us to have 3 good sized pieces of pork. The fried rice was okay, but not spectacular. What really stood out though was the prawns! I don't think I have had prawns that were as good as those in a long time. Quite a surprise after the lackluster prawns in the spring rolls. The variety of tastes and textures made for a very pleasant meal.

We also ordered Thai iced tea. Definitely not one of the better Thai iced teas I've had, but I suppose a Thai restaurant would be a better place to order that than a Vietnamese restaurant. My friend ordered the lemonaid, and it was quite fresh, but had a little too much sugar.

We came in quite hungry and had plenty to eat and were pleasantly surprised that the total bill for the meal with tax came to just over $53 for the three of us. Not a bad deal at all for a good meal in a nice San Francisco neighborhood. We would definitely go back if we found ourselves in that area of the city again.
author: Debi T.

description:
I love this vietnamese restaurant.  I have been here sooo many times with friends and family members.  I even recommended to my coworks and we ordered the food to be delivered to our work for the lunch meetings.  AND sure enough, all my coworkers love the food.  Now, we order Aux Delices to deliver to my work at least once a month for group lunches.

Most of the items on the manu are good, my favorites are the carmelized clay pot fish and bbq beef.

happy eating.
author: Truong P.

description:
Food = Outstanding
Drink = sober
Ambiance = Good
Service = ok
Return = absolutely

Vermicelli pork and egg roll is the best around.  
Used to live in SF and would come here weekly.
Egg rolls are the best, been to A LOT of Vietnamese restaurants and nothing compares!
author: Joanne S.

description: I have been to Aux Delices several times now to dine in or pick up food. Their quality is always consistent, food so yummy and service so nice and friendly. I am a fan for life :)
author: Kanwal A.

description: Amazing! I haven't given a 5 star review in a long time, but this place is definitely deserving. The best pho EVER though I think they're known even more for the other more French inspired dishes on their menu. I was craving pho in the chilly SF weather and I haven't been so satisfied in a long time. The broth was packed full of complex flavors and the noodles were perfection with a nice texture - not overcooked. Thanks to my friend Marilynn for introducing us. We'll definitely be coming back. Oh, also the owner is super hard working and gracious - very impressive to see her serving her own tables and investing herself in her work on a busy Saturday night. Cheers!
author: Debbie Chiou S.

description:
I have eaten at some pretty amazing Vietnamese restaurants (can't beat some places in San Jose), the food here wasn't too bad. We ordered the garlic noodles (since it seemed quite popular by other reviewers), caramelized catfish in clay pot, and the 2nd beef dish on the menu (can't remember the actual name but it's 2 long pieces of beef on skewers with vegetables and fish sauce). 

The garlic noodles were good, though it was nothing extraordinary (still love Thanh Long's garlic noodles)...noodles with just a butch of garlic and oil. The catfish was good, but had an interesting taste that I'm not used to when I typically eat this dish. It definitely was more oily than other versions I had before. The beef was the best dish here. It was very flavorful and paired nicely with the rice (btw...just order the bowl since each cup is $2). 

As for the service, if you are Asian...expect slower service (maybe we just caught them at a bad time? maybe? haha...trying to justify it).
author: Tif L.

description:
Can you paint by number? 

Ordering Aux Delices is really that simple. 

Always start with:
#16b - Garlic noodles
#30 - Crispy chicken
Side Rice: Jasmine (or brown)

There you go Picasso :)

Now.. Do you remember the "Choose Your Own Adventure" books? (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Choose_Your_Own_Adventure)

Order by the # of the adventure you want to turn to...

#32 - Broccoli sauteed with garlic, ginger, and your choice of meat.
#37 - Chicken in caramel sauce; or (27) - Shrimp/Pork in caramel.
#14 - Spring rolls/peanut sauce (not fried)... I LOVE the peanut sauce!
#50 - Shaken filet cubes

Dine-in, Deliver quick... or procrastinate & pick up when parking is easy- but order by 9:50-9:55pm.

As long as you order by number, wherever you eat you are sure to be "at delight"... Aux Delices. Touche ;)
author: Courtney B.

description: It is not your standard super beefy pho. it is very mild ( but my kind kind of mild) so for that this place is awesome. their bun dishes are pretty darn smoking too. id try anything they do with lemon grass in it as they have hit the right balance. everything else is meh
author: Caesar H.

description:
One of my favorite go-to spots in Russian Hill. Very reasonably priced and the food is always delicious (my regulars are the crispy chicken, papaya salad, shaking beef, and garlic noodles) - I'm so glad that it's just down the street!  Service is fine, but definitely not the selling point but also not enough to detract from the overall experience. 

A great spot for casual dinner or take out!
author: Jess B.

description: I can't believe I don't go here more!  Everything we had was excellent.  We shared the pork and shrimp clay pot dish in caramel sauce, chicken curry and a dried chicken dish.  Everything we ordered was a hit.  I will definitely add this to my repertoire of take out food close by.  Can't wait to try more dishes
author: Kirsten M.

description: Wow, make your own sugar cane shrimp and spring rolls was a great starter, then the rest of the food was even better
author: Bill W.

description:
Freakin' delicious.  Just writing this review makes me hungry.

Stars:
1. crispy chicken (#30)
2. carmelized salmon in the claypot (#56 - I think?)
3. garlic noodles (#16b?)
4. vietnamese crepe
5. lichee gelato

Everything on the menu is great.  The starter platter is perfect to try all the appetizers...

The place is family owned and their family is friendly and I love that they remember me.  The owner chris and his wife are great.

YUMMMYYYYYYYYYYYYYY.  Can't wait to go back!
author: Melody T.

description:
This place is *such* a great find.  I've been there 4 times in the last year and have never been let down.   The service is pretty good in general and the food is fresh and flavorful.  My favorite menu item by far is the charbroiled steak (with tons of garlic on top and perfectly cooked veggies on the side).

Other favorites are the caramel claypot chicken (amazing taste!) and the garlic noodles.  As far as starters go, the spring rolls are crisp and refreshing and the charbroiled pork slices and the sauce they came with were great.  The only thing I have ever not liked here was the stuffed chicken rolls.  They just had a weird taste.

This place looks upscale, but won't break the bank....classy joint all the way.  Try and get a booth for more intimate conversation -- it can get kind of loud on weekend nights.
author: mary r.

description:
I believe a good Vietnamese restaurant can be identified by 2 factors:

1)  Quality of Pho Broth
2)  Freshness of Spring Roll or Crispy to flavor ratio of Imperial rolls.  

I went with a good friend and perhaps it's because I'm from the East/South Bay where there is pho aplenty, but I felt like this place was quite pricey.   I ordered the Medium and it was a good size - it's can't possibly be healthy to down the ginormous bowl that pho hoa and like restaurants serve...so, a good size.  The meat was pretty tender.  The broth, however, was a bit too salty.  

We only ordered the Imperial rolls - they were very tasty.  Crispy and kind of juicy (sounds gross, I know).  I wish there was more of the rice noodle.

Overall, it was a good experience - I like their decor and had no problems with the service.  

It's in an amazing area and I'm determined to come back and try all the restaurants on Polk.
author: Helen F.

description:
This place is great! I have ordered food for delivery numerous times and eaten in the restaurant once. Their green papaya salad is so good that sometimes I order from them just because I have a craving for the spicy, sweet deliciousness of the green papaya salad with shrimp.

Some of my other favorites include the chicken pho, the noodle salad with chicken and lemongrass, and the caramel chicken.

The service for both the restaurant and the delivery is excellent. My only complaint is that the server wasn't quite fast enough with refilling our water glasses for how spicy the food was.
author: Dani D.

description:
What a wonderful little find!! I can't say that I just stumbled across this restaurant, it had been on my radar for a long time - however, even having read reviews, I was expecting a solid but standard Vietnamese restaurant. I was wrong. The menu was extensive and unique and I just wanted to order everything. I went in with my mind made up that I was ordering pho - standard - but upon browsing through the menu, I realized there was a much bigger world of delicious food out there. Therefore, I branched out and ordered #15 the Bun - Noodle Salad with Sauteed Chicken (all white meat) with Lemongrass. It was fabulous! A great balance between fresh and savory. I personally never order meat when I go to an Asian restaurant - perhaps because I am usually weary of the quality and I'm not a huge meat eater to begin with. However, I took my chances this time and was really happy with the results. 

My boyfriend had the beef pho and the dumpling appetizer. Both were good choices as well.

Wine prices are very decent - I think my glass of Viogner was 6 dollars - not the best wine in the world but it was certainly suitable for the dinner. They have bottles for $23 dollars - that's an average of $4.60 per glass...not bad.

The best surprise of the night came as I was eating and thoroughly enjoying my dinner. I said "I really wish this place delivered" - come do find out, they do! $20 minimum and an extra fee (not stated but guessing 3%) for using credit card on all deliveries. I have a feeling this will become my go-to delivery restaurant, along with Yukol Thai, I can't give that one up.

Speaking of minimums, there is a $10 minimum per diner which I guess could be a little frustrating if you only want one of their $8 meals (of which there are a decent amount) - however if you are dining in, treat yourself to a glass of wine or sake and you're good to go - if you are doing take-out, any dish is probably worth about $10 anyhow so I'd just consider that the menu price and pay the $10 without a fuss. 

Ambiance is decent as well. Really, this is a fantastic, affordable restaurant with a wide variety of menu items. On a final note - I had no issue with the service as was mentioned in other reviews. They were attentive and well-paced though I did dine at 8:45 PM on a Tuesday night...
author: Katie S.

description:
Best pho in the city over every single place we have tried so far. We love Ha, the owner who always makes it a point to chat with us for a while. 

Pho is light and fragrant, fresh and delicious. We sometimes eat here for lunch AND dinner in less than a 24hour period, no joke.

We love Aux Delices!
author: michelle h.

description:
I love this place! It's a great restaurant to get a good meal with friends while not having spend a fortune. I always like to start with a soup like the crab and asparagus or perhaps get their rice porridge. Their imperial rolls are super yummy, but my favorite dish of theirs is definitely the crispy chicken in a sweet sauce. My only wish would be that they add some vegetables in it but nothing is perfect. I've tried some of the other dishes, and they are all generally pretty good.

On a random note, this restaurant always has a lot of great eye candy. Perhaps it's because Crunch is across the street. After all the sweaty jocks work out, they probably need to satisfy their hunger. HAHAHA!
author: Alex C.

description: Went there this weekend and this time tried new dishes. It was delicious!! The entire table was pleased with the food, price and service. Loved it and still love it
author: Meryl C.

description:
I love their Garlic Noodles!  All right, so that's not exactly a tough dish to make, but for some reason the ones they have here seem to just hit the spot for me.  I live walking distance from here, and I find it's a good meal for a lazy Sunday afternoon.

Service was ok, not much interaction, but at least it's quick.  And, boy are they on top of keeping your water filled.  I don't think I took more than two sips without having it re-filled.

I wouldn't go here if I was looking to get Pho or something like that since it's a little pricier than you would generally find for Vietnamese food, but for the main courses everything i've tried so far has been pretty good. And, the service is generally better than a small Pho shop.
author: Ted G.

description:
This is my favorite local spot. Low key atmosphere, good food, something for everyone and attentive service. 

Couple items to try on their menu: chicken pho, non-fried veggie rolls, imperial rolls, lemon grass chicken and garlic noodles.
author: Whitney S.

description:
I walked into Aux Delices at 9:45pm, desperate for some pho. The decor made me nervous. It was too nice for a pho place, then I realized I was on Polk Street and I had probably walked into some yuppie Asian place. Shit.

The hostess was pretty nice. I was disappointed to find out that they only had one type of pho on the menu. Just "Beef noodle soup" or "chicken noodle soup," no tripe, or steak or flank options- I again had to remind myself that I was on Polk Street, not in Chinatown. 

The service was fast, I got it to go and brought it home to my bf. We both thought the pho was better than expected (I expected beef water, but they gave us the right accompaniments!), but it cost me $9 a bowl, which is about 50% more than what I'm used to paying. Oh wait, Polk Street!

Either way, if I was desperate for some pho I'd have it again, but paying $9 for pho of okay quality kind of sucks.
author: Emily H.

description:
I found this place to be very underwhelming.  Here's what me and a friend ordered:

Garlic Noodles
Vegetable Curry
Cha Ca (grilled basa fillet)

So the portions are sizeable which is nice, but the flavors and the food felt kind of random and non-purposeful and not especially memorable.  I've had garlic noodles much better.  The vegetable curry smelled great, but I can't even remember what it tasted like or what was included.

The grilled basa fillet had dill in it and it was completely overpowering so after a bite or two we just avoided it.  

The restaurant is spacious, but really dark.
author: Jamie L.

description:
I've been wanting to stop in here for a long time.  I cannot tell you why it's taken me so damn long to cross the threshold.  Too damn long is all I can say.

We stopped in spur of the moment for a lunch.  Began with the best green papaya salad I have ever eaten, bar none.  BURSTING with flavors, not at all skimpy on the shrimp.  If I could have licked the plate clean, I would have.  We were sitting in the window, so decorum prevailed.

We shared a Vietnamese Crepe as an entree.  It, too, was delicious.  I thought it was a tad on the greasy side, but that was the only thing close to negative about it.  The filling was generous and it arrived with all the salad ingredients you expect.  Yummy.

Since lunch was light, we had room for a custard desert.  Again, delicious.  It does not erase the glorious giandua custard from Osteria, but it was excellent.

Serive was attentive and not overly hovering.  Food was delivered hot/cold fresh.  Ambiance is lovely.  I'm sure with the place packed to the rafters it would be very noisy. For lunch it was about 1/4 full and lovely.

Absolutely, will be back, wish it could be today!
author: Donna H.

description: Throwing in an extra star for the amazing service.  We've become semi-regulars at Aux Delices, and the waitress always remembers our names and orders no matter how long it's been since we last visited.  The food is always delivered super quickly, is delicious, and they never charge for extra fish sauce - woot! :)
author: Allison B.

description: very tasty and conveniently located on polk street. make sure you know exactly what you want when you order to go, being very clear about your order. i wanted an order of imperial rolls and wanted clarification as to how many rolls were in each order. we went back and forth about there being 4 rolls and how thats how many i wanted...ended up with 4 orders of imperial rolls.
author: Clayton S.

description:
Clay pot chicken = yum. sweet almost caramel like flavor permeated the dish.

The floral jasmin tea is a wonderful addition to the meal. Nice interior, friendly servers and moderately priced. They lose a star for charging for rice though.
author: Russ C.

description:
We loved our experience at Aux Delices.  The spring rolls are fresh and tasty, but we asked for peanut sauce which arrived with too much soy sauce in it.  The Thai Iced-tea was ok, the wine list offers a reasonable selection, the service is prompt and friendly, and the restaurant is also a great place to people watch (you can be seated by the window looking out to Polk St.).  My boyfriend got the beef skewers which were very delicious!  I have had the caramel chicken which is brought out still sizzling (mmmmmmmmm!!) and the 5 spice chicken had a bit too much sauce on it.  The chicken rice porridge was wonderful.  Tasty food for a very reasonable price!

Final rating 4.5 stars - lost half a star for the peanut sauce, but we usually eat at Thai places so we're extra picky about that.
author: Robyn Y.

description: Really like this place. Can't go wrong with their food. Just ask for the special and I'm sure it won't disappoint. My favorite is their crap asparagus soup. I've had this soup at other Vietnamese restaurant and I must say that this restaurant has the best one. Parking can be difficult so plan ahead. The staff is not bad either.
author: J C.

description:
This is one of those restaurants I'd walked by in the neighborhood a hundred times and never tried it.  Then I met another neighborhood friend here who said he ate here at least once a week.  Well, now, so do I.

Don't miss: imperial rolls and the tamarind soup.
author: Amber S.

description:
This is not your pho joint.  They definitely have that on the menu, but if I were you I'd try things known for at slanted door for a fraction of the slanted door price.  

We had: papaya salad with calamari, shaken beef, caramel salmon, and fried bananas to finish.  And everything was delicious! 

A solid Vietnamese restaurant on this lovely end of Polk street.
author: Jiajia C.

description:
The Yang Sing of Vietnamese food and less expensive than Slanted Door/Out the Door. 

I really like this place - having recently been introduced to restaurants on Polk Street.  It's bigger than it looks from the outside, the service is absolutely amazing and the food is good. Don't come here expecting to eat lots for little bucks, it is priced just like it should be for the neighborhood this restaurant is in. But saves you a trip across town for Vietnamese food if you're already in the area. 

Hard to find parking... but otherwise, not a bad find for Polk Street.
author: Lisa L.

description: Tasty yet a tad pricier than other vietnamese places.  Service was a little slow.
author: Aaron A.

description:
Dropped in to grab pho one night but found parking right across the street so decided to stay and eat.  Really glad we did since it meant I tried some new stuff!
I had a mushroom and chicken soup (Mien Ga) which was really light and delicious - I love bean thread/glass noodles; plus a few bites of Arlyne's soup which was definitely heartier, oilier, and more flavor intensive.  Both were fab.  
We also shared the spring rolls which were exactly what you'd expect.
Friendly, cooperative service, decent prices and delicious food.  They get that fifth star from me on soup alone - is that fair?
author: Jennifer D.

description: Pricey Vietnamese food.  We had pho and chicken porridge.  Everything was tasty and good.   Service was a little slow and unfriendly.
