Quite pathetic that it took me a year and a half to finally make it down the street to Aux Delices,  since it's a scarce four blocks from my house and was highly recommended by my foodie friends. 

A much overdue catch-up with a girl friend presented the perfect opportunity to finally check this place out, and I  was not disappointed. We had spring rolls and a starter soup, then got the caramel chicken and a tofu/veggie dish with garlic sauce. The soup and caramel clay pot chicken were wonderful with a great blend of flavors and just enough spice. The tofu dish was more mediocre, but then again, we probably should have asked our waitress for a suggestion on that one. 

Bonus points for very moderate prices and comfortable decor that is just nice enough to be a good date spot but casual enough to be unpretentious. Next time, I go for garlic noodles and one of the curries.
author: Chelsea R.

description:
Great restaurant. Wonderful appetizers that dance on the palette.

I've yet to have a less than phenomenal meal here!
author: Inga R.

description:
Pretty authentic Vietnamese food. I ordered the canh chua soup and Ca kho To - Fish in a clay pot, papaya salad - delicious. 

The fish clay pot was very close to how I would have cooked it. Canh Chua soup was ok. It came off a bit bland to me.

Ah, but the best one is the fried banana with vanilla ice cream. Delicious.
author: Michelle N.

description: I tried this restaurant last week for dinner. The food was pretty good and quite reasonably priced. I would say its probably better for a date because it felt a bit quiet and not quite as upbeat as some of the other asian restaurants on polk.
author: Ash S.

description: I come here for Vietnamese food when I don't want to walk further to Chinatown.  Their food is decent, but not worth the high prices.  I get agitated every time I pay $9 for a bowl of mediocre pho.
author: Suzy K.

description: This place is great!  Food is consistent.   They deliver and the restaurant itself if beautiful, quiet, and friendly.  Very reasonable prices, great service.
author: Alex T.

description:
I went to Aux Delices on a whim Friday night with some friends. We had been in the area, at a wine tasting and then decided we needed to eat. As we walked around Polk St. I noticed the sign and mentioned that I have just recently started eating Vietnamese food, so I asked my friends if we could try it? I was preety happy that we did.
Since there was four of us, we had a bit of everything. They have a great beer selection and a pretty nice sized menu, too. My only complaint was  that it took us a bit to get the waitress attention at times, but she was pretty busy. I would come back and BTW, the bill was only  $90  (w/tip) and that included 7 beers!  :O)
author: Lisa A.

description:
What a cute little place! The food was really good, the service was pretty attentive (kinda sorta).

We had a large party, and my friend had gotten a reservation. When we got there, the table was practically ready, and we were seated pretty quickly. The selection of the food is wide, with lots of dishes to choose from, including plenty of vegetarian dishes (we had two vegetarians eating with us). Everyone was really happy with what they ordered.

Oh one thing... I ordered an iced vietnamese coffee and it was fantastic! Just the right ratio of milk to coffee. What was really cool is that they brought it to the table still hot with the brewer, and then provided a glass of ice, so we all sat and oohed and ahhed over the brewing, stirring, pouring over ice, and then ultimately drinking of the iced coffee. Mmm... Oh it was so good. I think I'll just order a bunch of those next time and get all hopped up on caffeine and sweet milk!
author: Reese W.

description:
More like 3.5 stars.

I just love Vietnamese food. I'm always looking for good Vietnamese food and I am also now on a search for a good Vietnamese sandwich.

It's a nice looking restuarant inside with butterscotch and lemon custard colored walls. Very relaxing atmosphere. 

They had an awesome reisling by the glass. I wanted a whole bottle as soon as I took a sip. Might not be dry enough for some. Their garlic noodles are awesome-not too garlicky like Pho Tudo and not drowning in butter like Thanh Long. The five spice chicken was yummy it was cut like small breast fillets instead of small pieces of chicken and the glass noodles with crab were also quite good.

I'm a little torn for the review. The food is good, but with the difficulty in parking in the neighborhood and the higher prices and smaller portions I don't know that I would come back here to eat. I think the only way I would come back is because the BF would drag me here for the crepe. All the vietnamese restaurants we go to do not serve the crepe.
Yummy five spice chicken
Biggest plus in my yelp book-they have Vietnamese crepes. It was absolutely delicious here.

Parking
author: Maria M.

description:
Yum Yum Yum!!! 

I'm very very picky when it comes to most Asian food, but love love love this place! Specifically I love their Imperial Rolls and their chicken with broccoli. When you order dishes with chicken its actually real chicken, and not overly greasy. I know when I order chinese food, i can't always tell what part of the chicken I'm eating because when I make chicken it doesn't look like that. At Aux Delice it's just delish. 

I even liked their green papaya salad - while a bit too spicy for me, I liked it nonetheless.
author: Lindsay A.

description: I used to live a couple blocks from this place and it was my go to whenever I couldn't figure out what I wanted for dinner.  It's great for take-out and for eating in.  I've since moved to the Inner Richmond, but we still make the trek over and hassle with parking just for their crispy chicken.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Small bowls for $8.  As in small bowls like what you would have at your mothers house on a rainy day when you were a kid.  Had the Pho Tai and noticed it was the same broth for Beef and Chicken Pho which was just salty crap. Has to be the worst pho I've ever had.  Next time I'm in need of a cure I'm just going 10 blocks south to Pho Vietnam.
author: Jason v.

description:
I have mixed feelings about this restaurant. I will start with the pros then the cons. 

The ambiance and environment was really enjoyable. The decorations and general feeling of the restaurant made it very relaxing to have dinner here. The service was fantastic, the waiter and waitress who was serving us constantly brought us water and remembered what we ordered.

The aesthetics and service of this restaurant is fantastic but it does not cover up the mediocre food that was served to us. I had some pork and it was bland in flavor. The texture was prefect but it was tasteless. The noodles did not have any flavor and felt average at best.

Now there are some other things that made this experience even more mix. When the waitress started to serve us our entrees, she realized that the appetizer wasn't even there yet. I give her props for remembering what we ordered but I felt that they shouldn't have forgotten about the appetizer since it wasn't all that busy. This is not exactly the restaurants fault but the people that were sitting next to my girlfriend and I were ridiculous. I admit that I was not wearing the most appropriate attire, basketball shorts and a t-shirt, but at least I did not put chopsticks in my mouth and started to act like a walrus. Not only that, they kept moving the table and playing around like children even though they were adults in their late 20s/early 30s.
author: Francisco H.

description: Quick service and great food! Everything we ordered was yummy!
author: Ameena G.

description:
I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT!!!! Its family owned (which is the reason I LOVE IT) and the food is extremely good... 

I really do not know what to say about this restaurant.... Like if you have ever had good Vietnamese food, you know what is all about... freshness, perfectly spiced food that is light and just good... it is the anti-thesis of chinese food... because you do not feel stuffed after your done eating.....

my friend said it has been voted over and over again by chefs that the best food in the world is Vietnamese food... im starting to believe it and see why... 

great place for a date.... 

final conclusion: cozy, good grub, friendly, good service, fresh... 

make sure you get the friend bananas...i think its the best in the city....
author: Jason I.

description:
Great Vietnamese. Every dish is fresh and well prepared, and the service is quite good. 

I love the garlic ginger sticky-sauce chicken.

Surprisingly impressive and incredibly cheap wine list as a bonus.

Excellent budget-dining option.
author: Jaclyn C.

description: I got a fish with rice noodle dish which was excellent and had some unbelievably good Indonesian cinnamon gelato for dessert!
author: Eric M.

description:
Love it! This is only the 2nd Vietnamese Restaurant that I have been too. The first is in Oakland and also very good. My absolute favorite dish is the Beef Salad, its Filet Mignon in am amazing spicy dressing. I always order my meat rare but unless you specifically ask they serve the meat med rare. So far I have had the garlic noodles, beef and broccoli and chicken in a curry sauce.. Loved it all.

My vietnamese palet is not sophisticated I just know what I like and this is damn good and the price is also very nice.
author: David H.

description:
Yum, finally food that's just as good as mom's! Don't dismiss them if you don't see Asians eating here...I'm Vietnamese and grew up in San Jose with great home cooked meals...this place makes me happy! Slanted door is great too but it's got a longer waiting list and much higher prices. 

I recently ate at Aux Delices a couple weeks ago for the 2nd time and I enjoyed it so much more than the 1st time. Perhaps I just ordered better but the food was incredibly delicious. I have been looking for a Vietnamese restaurant that I can go to and get my Vietnamese fix yet not be disappointed afterwards. 

At Aux Delices we enjoyed:
1. Bun Bo Xao (sauteed beef with lemongrass and noodles)
2. Ga Chien (crispy chicken in sweet, spicy, garlic sticky sauce)
3. Tom rang muoi (salt and pepper prawns in shell)
4. Brown rice

All dishes were fantastic and made me anticipate the next time I can return for more! Service was friendly, good, and timing of food was perfect.
author: Mellie D.

description:
4.5 stars!

Came here twice, once with a group of 6-7 and once as two people. This is a family-run restaurant, and I love the food here. Their Vietnamese dishes were nicely prepared and delicious. The interior and atmosphere are very classy. The staff (part of the family I assume) is very friendly and accommodating. I particularly like their appetizer sampler, where you can try different things all at once.

Parking isn't that great around there, so prepare to circle around a few times and pray to the parking gods (or whoever you pray to).
author: Sam W.

description:
Tastes like my grandma's cookin!  ...and my grandma is a awesome cook.  I go to this restaurant when I want a little taste of home.  

Nice friendly staff, great tasting food and traditional flavors.
author: Alex L.

description:
The ambience is okay and decor is nice but the food is really mediocre. The portions are small and the veggies aren't super fresh (you know when the bean sprouts aren't firm but rather limp?) 

Anyway, I continue to come here for my Vietnamese fix because their cuisine is so freaking awesome. But honestly, I rather head down to Turtle Tower, Kim Son, or Pho Vietnam any day of the week.
author: Jane C.

description:
Ok, I'm really going on a limb by sharing this secret.  Aux Delices is now my most coveted Vietnamese joint in the city.  Shhh.  Yummy Yummy was top, but if you want even better quality of food and a very clean quiet atmosphere, with low prices, this is it!  Please don't tell too many people :)

Also, they have one of the hardest Vietnamese dishes to make...Buen Cun, or on the menu as "Vietnamese Dumplings".  It's an appetizer with cooked ground pork and black mushrooms.  The wrap is made of rice flour and and steamed over a drum, then carefully pulled off with a long chopstick... how do I know?  My mom made me do this cooking process for hours!!!  I'll pay anything to eat these and not make them!
author: Krankee C.

description:
Ambiance it does not have but good food it does. It's like Bong Su w/o the chi chi decor and the yummy drinks but the glass noodles w/ seafood kicked serious ass! The bo luc lac - which translates to Beef so good I want to marry you - was super tender and delicious. Big ups to the crab and asparagus soup too - just like Alexio's (that's my Vietnamese friend who could kick Bobby Flay's ass in a throw down). 
To top it off, we had the nicest waitress in the world. So 4 stars you ask? It's really more like 4.5 stars 'cause our Vietnamese crepe was a tad on the over-fried side.

I'll double down on this fo sho!
author: Lauren D.

description:
Fancy Vietnamese, but cheap and delicious.  Good work.  I've had everything here and it's all good, especially the green papaya salad with seafood.

They deliver too.
author: Scott W.

description:
Get the Imperial Rolls, Crispy Chicken, Ginger & Garlic sauted veggies, and rice.

Pho is excellent.
author: Jacob J.

description:
Feels awesome to have an addition to the delivery rotation that's not pizza, greasy Indian, or generic Thai. And, if that wasn't happy news enough, the food's actually fantastic! Fresh spring rolls, garlic noodles, and various varieties of beef/vegetables were on order. And there wasn't a dissonant voice in the house! 
Just wish they'd speed up a teensy bit. Or maybe a lot. And not charge so much.
author: Purnima M.

description:
mmmh... this was tasty. I can't remember exactly what we ordered, since we were a group of friends and all shared but it was all very yum. I'll definitely come back here and explore more, especially since I'm not Vietnamese-savvy yet. 
This was also the night I learned binary, which puts this restaurant on my 'special places' list
author: Alexandra D.

description: Hate to do this to one of my old favorites, but not sure what is going on.  Inconsistent food (cooking and flavoring), higher prices, less quantity and for the amount you expect for a Thai Ice tea, I expect a full glass that does not contain a watered down drink.
author: M P.

description:
Aux Delices is the boyfriend I always wished I had...there for me no matter what I look like, willing to deliver at weird hours of the night, and extremely good looking without being high maintenance.  Not sure if that worked or not but I do feel a sort of romantic love for this restaurant.

Everyone has that one picky eater friend that when you eat together you wonder why you even keep them around...that friend I would bring here.  I get to indulge my addicition for Vietnamese food and they are able to find something suitably "normal" without complaint.

I love the pork bun, garlic noodles, caramel salmon in a clay pot, STEAMED DUMPLINGS, ect.  I will eat at any sketchy restaurant in SF if it is "authentic" but I really don't even have to because this place is the same price and better.  Yum.
author: Amber B.

description:
Pretty standard Vietnamese fare:  

**Good Pho - not the best, but still good enough to help on days such as these.
**Yummy Salad Rolls - Peanutty dipping pleasure.

The right price for a lunch with work colleagues.  $10ish.
author: Rachel G.

description:
From the two dishes I tried, I'm super stoked about coming back to Aux Delices.  The restaurant provided a much wider array of options than I had seen on most Vietnamese menus, whether they were hole-in-the-walls, middle range white table cloth Vietnamese, or fancy-dancy fusion.  And the two fish dishes I had were really stellar, and at a much better price that I would have expected.

I came here with a friend who loves this place and I left totally in agreement.  On my friend's recommendation we got the Cha Ca ($12) "Grilled Filets of white fish over fresh dill & green onions with sake anchovy sauce" which was a bowl very tasty white fish with a sauce and herb mix that made every bite a delight.  It was hard to pull myself away from it to try the caramel salmon ($11) while it was still piping hot.  The salmon dish was a simply cooked salmon in a very hot caramel sauce.  My sweet-adverse friend loved it too and didn't think it was "too sweet" which is rare.

Our friends had one of the rolls and loved it, though their salad was "just salad" our third friend got the vegetarian chow-mein and loved it so much he got another plate of it.  I tried a little and it didn't change my dislike of chow-mein, but he seemed totally satisfied.

Their unfiltered sake ($4 / $6.5) was also great.   It was milky white and slightly sweet, somewhat like coconut water, but it was so tasty that two other people ordered large bottles after trying mine.

I'm hoping to come back here enough to raise the stars to the roof.
author: Tom W.

description:
Here's the breakdown:
Quality of Food:  4 stars.
Do they deliver?  Yes?!?!?  On time too?!?!?!?:  1 star.  

It's a fantastic alternative to pizza folks.
author: Ria D.

description:
I love the food here, but I'm giving the place four stars because the service is inconsistent.  Sometimes it's fantastic and sometimes it's not so good.  I've been here enough times to know the service isn't necessarily dependent on the server.  I've received good and bad service from the same staff members.  

Pho - Very good for SF.  Fresh ingredients.  However, portion size is laughable.  If you serve Pho, you need to offer the mega-size bowl for $1.00-$2.00 more than the mini bowl.  Those are the rules.  I didn't write them.  They don't even OFFER the mega-size bowl.  I know I'm going to be hungry an hour after eating it anyway, so there is no point in getting Pho unless the bowl is twice the size of my head. 

Bun Cha Gio - Fried eggrolls on vermicelli.  Okay, granted this is not an uncomplicated dish, but it's easy to screw up the right proportion of noodles, to egg rolls, to cucumbers, cilantro, etc.  They do it well enough here that I've had it more than a handful of times.  If their nuoc cham (fish sauce, galic, lime, red pepper), though tasty, wasn't weaksauce, I'd give this dish an A.  Instead it gets an A-.

Com Thit Nuong - Pan fried pork chop on rice.  Nothing to write home about, but a solid B.  Again, nuoc cham, vital factor.
author: Teresa N.

description: Went on a relatively busy Saturday night. First impressions were good based on decor and friendly server. Appetizer sampler was good, not great. They have an interesting menu but I opted for Bun Cha Gio Thit Nuong, which is my standard first dish to try at Vietnamese restaurants. The entrée was respectable, but I've had better at several local places that were cheaper as well. While waitress was friendly and helpful upon arrival, she seemed to completely disappear and didn't ask how everything tasted until I was 2 or 3 bites from being done. If not for the superb Vietnamese food I've eaten in other cities and other local spots I would probably rave about this place.
author: Jayson H.

description: Went with some friends, nice decor, great service, good food wish the garlic noodle had more garlic but if you are looking for a nice Vietnamese Restaurant on Polk St. try it out
author: David J.

description: I love Pho, but I still have yet to try it here.  The sampler appetizer platter is perfect for 2-4 people.  I'm a fan of fried egg rolls and my gf loves the spring rolls.  It's the best of all worlds.  Big fan of the curry and you get rather large portions!  You'll spend a bit of change here (~20-25 each), but it's not bad at all consider you will leave full and with a little doggie bag to take home some leftovers.  Unless, of course, you're a pig like me, in which case you'll just leave full.  Haven't tried the desserts yet, so I'll have to report back again some day.
author: Joel G.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for awhile I made a reservation for 8pm to take visiting friends. 

At the restaurant, random blonde girl saw me approaching the waiter and cut in front to insist to the waiter she wanted to sit. He told her he couldn't seat her as they had to wait for her entire party to arrive.
She then rudely steamrolled the poor waiter and sat down at our  table anyway. I now see why waiters won't seat you until the whole group is there. The waitstaff ran a muck trying to get a new table for us while she sat by herself unnecessarily in our booth. Besides the point the table was reserved for us, her group wouldn't have had to wait as they showed up much later. Unfortunately her actions got the night off to a bad start. 

The food obviously wasn't as good as Slanted Door but still tasty. The Prawn Sugar Cane Spring Rolls were delicious though my lazy friends complained it was too much work as you actually have to make the rolls yourself. The best was the Prawns and Pork Clay Pot though it was a little salty. The Shaking Beef wasn't quite as tender as other restaurants. Actually everything was a tad to salty but I got the feeling it was an off night. 

I thought ambiance was fine, it's not a fancy restaurant but it's not anything to be ashamed of either. Service was not great as the restaurant got busy and we hardly saw our waiter but the staff was really nice.

I'd definitely come back and give them a second chance. I really want to give them at least 4 stars. Overall I'm quite quite excited to find a new place near me - they do takeout!

Also I'm going to kick blonde girl's ass if I ever meet her again.
author: Princess Pompom Patootie W.

description:
The name says it all,
Better than the Slanted Door, 
Delivery too.
author: Brian J.

description: Food was fresh and good but HORRIBLE delivery time took over 11/2 to get food we were STARVING.  Then called to check on order and said it was "processed late"  ya right probably just put it in then.
author: katie v.

description: For the price you'd think the kitchen wouldn't overcook meats. The one saving grace was the chicken rice porridge. That was definitely special.
author: Derrick V.

description:
Imagine being so hungry that you are considering eating your own arm.  That is how hungry I was when I ate there.  
I had the Thai Beef Salad.  Sooooooooo good.  
Then I had the Beef Curry.  Wow.  If I lived near by I would be eating that curry or that salad at least once a week.
author: John M.

description:
Wow. Great service, great food, awesome lychee and saki drinks. 
Liked the sweet chicken, prawns, soup. 
Reasonable prices.
author: peter d.

description: Had the beef, imperial rolls and fried rice for $10.75!  Delicious and filling.  Very nice service also
author: Karen B.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in SF. Family owned, and always delicious. While I can't speak to how authentic the food is, I have been to a lot of Vietnamese restaurants and nothing compares to Aux Delices. Great service, though some servers (as expected) are better than others. Also great for kids, as we take my 2.5 year old there all the time. They are great for take-out or eat in, and they also deliver within the neighborhood. Love this place!
author: Megan L.

description: It is nice to have some reasonably-priced food in Russian Hill - especially tasty reasonably-priced food!  Aux Delices has good food at really reasonable prices - I had a tasty bun (yes, it is one of my favorites) for ~$8.  My friends and I were a relatively large party (about eight of us) and had no problems getting seated around 8ish on a Wednesday night.  The service is quick and prompt - a great place to have a good, relatively quick meal.
author: Wendy L.

description:
We sat at the table waiting for maybe 30 minutes before our unapologetic surly server took our order.

We ordered the sampler appetizer platter, red snapper and white fish fillet entrees.  Everything looked a bit sad on the plate swimming in an inch of grease.  The fish was well-cooked but once again grease city.  

The fresh herbs and hot sauce were probably the only thing I enjoyed about this place.  

I would definitely not go back here.

Update:
The owner was kind enough to write to apologize, citing unexpectedly short staffing that night to explain the wait time.  She also offered to discount dinner. The sentiment is appreciated :).
author: Flaneur C.

description: Love Aux Delices. Service is always really friendly and efficient. And food is great!!
author: Mary W.

description:
AUX DELICES ISN'T isn't the world's best or most authentic Vietnamese place, but it's usually fairly reliable, and the place is pleasant to look at.  

Try the caramel (whatever) in the claypot -- it's always good.  The appetizers (spring/imperials rolls & pork dumplings) are mediocre -- well, the dumplings are just wrong (thick, cold, clumsy).  (Go to Tay Ho in Oakland Chinatown if you want them done right.) That said, it's a favorite place on Polk.
author: Daniel S.

description: Absolute hands-down favorite delivery place. Could probably eat their chicken pho every night of the week. The imperial rolls are delicious and the beef noodle salad is pretty amazing as well.
author: Maddy D.

description: YUMMM! I moved here recently and when my fridge is without Aux Delices leftovers, I feel that there is truly something missing. The garlic noodles really are amazing, and they will even add vegetables to them as per request. I love the Filet Mignon salad and chicken with basil, onions and peppers. Fast delivery. The lemonade is also delicious. Mmmm...just thinking about it makes my mouth salivate. Beware that you may become addicted. Aux DelicIOUS!
author: Brandilyn B.

description:
I'm lazy. There, I said it.  After working all day and commuting an hour each way, when I get home, I rarely want to cook. Heck, most of the time I don't even want to leave the house.  Unfortunately, this means that I tend to order the same basic things for delivery - Thai, Chinese, pizza, and Indian food.  Over and over and over again. 

When I found out that Aux Delices delivered, it was like the heavens opened up and smiled down upon me.  Maybe that's a little extreme, but it is so nice to have something new to add to my delivery rotation. I like the 5-spice chicken, garlic noodles, and pho. My fella is basically stuck on the beef skewers and even has me order them for him when he is not going to be home for dinner so he can have them as a midnight snack. Delivery is really prompt and the place isn't too expensive.  And can I just say again how thrilled I am that the food isn't Thai, Chinese, Indian or pizza?
author: Rebecca H.

description:
This is definitely my favorite vietnamese restaurant in the city- although I've not explored much in the Richmond so can't claim it's the best in the city, just my fave. Fresh, tasty, reasonably priced with a very nice ambiance. Plus the staff is really friendly.

I've taken almost all of my out of town guests here and try to eat here as much as possible because I'm addicted to their lemongrass soup. It's amazing!
author: Claire G.

description:
I give Aux Delices one star for delivering food on a rainy night. But then again, Dominos delivers as well .... and the food might have been more tasty.

This was not my idea of Vietnamese food. It was heavy, and the vegetables were limp and didn't feel fresh. The seasoning was salty and not flavorful. And it was EXPENSIVE - and they charged a $1 processing fee for using a credit card, on a $30 order.

I would think twice (or three or four or five .... times) before ordering food from here.
author: Rachel A.

description:
If you like vietnamese food but cant stand the crowds at the famous places, and/or the noise and bustle at the hole-in-the-walls, this place is for you.  

I go becuase its right around the corner and I cant seem to get sick of VN food.  Have tried a bunch of things and all were good.  Try the Aux Delices Mix Grill.  Usually quiet, unhurried and peaceful.  Slightly pricier than your regular Pho house, but a welcome change from the madness...
author: Brad C.

description: Good neighborhood place for a mid week meal.  On a Tuesday night the place was not full, but did a brisk business in take out orders.  Service was efficient, friendly and prompt.  We had a bowl of chicken and ginger congee style soup which I just loved.  Comfort food.  Followed this with an order of grilled fish - the cha ca.  The fish was excellent with little charred edges that added to the flavor but a bit too fiddly to mix all the veggies, salad leaves and rice noodles together.  The fried crepe was unusual and very tasty.  Little heavy on the oil but still I would enjoy it again.
author: Ash A.

description:
I'm not sure if I would have tried this place if it hadn't been for Yelp! And I am so glad I did. The crispy chicken was delicious, and the sauce was a nice blend of sweet, sour, and spicy. The catfish clay pot with the caramel sauce was also great. Remember to order some veggies though-- that's something I overlooked when I ordered. 

The service was fairly good, and the restaurant is clean and perfectly lit. You will go home happy! And apparently they deliver so I'm going to try that the next time it's pouring rain outside.

Nick better watch his tacos...
author: lindsay w.

description:
I was feeling pretty lazy and looking for delivery when I stumbled upon these reviews.  I took the advice of fellow reviewers and ordered the Imperial Rolls and Shaken Filet Mignon.  I was impressed not only by the quality of the food, but by how quickly it arrived.  On the phone they said 40 minutes, but 20 minutes after I called my food arrived steaming hot! Next time I am holed up in my apartment with a craving for Vietnamese, I know who to call!

UPDATE: Well, I guess the honeymoon is over.  Although my first experience with Aux Delices was impressive, my second was not so much.  Not that it was horrible -- I only deducted one star -- but it wasn't all that I had hoped for.  Hmmmmm...maybe third time's the charm...
author: Katie M.

description:
Simply the best take out on Polk St.

I live a few blocks from here and have eaten over half the menu since I moved in.  I have this place on speed dial.  Everything I've ordered is fantastic!

A few of my faves:
BO LUC LAC (aka: shaking beef) - amazingly tender filet mignon
BEEF THAI SALAD - the filet mignon is so tender and the salad dressing has the perfect kick
GARLIC NOODLES - great with caramel salmon
CARAMEL SALMON - see above for pairing
BUN NOODLE SALAD WITH PORK & IMPERIAL ROLLS - I can't (well... shouldn't...) polish off an entire order of the delicious imperial rolls on my own, so this is the perfect balance of healthy noodle salad and yummy fried imperial goodness
CHICKEN RICE PORRIDGE - perfect combination of ginger, chicken, and thick rice porridge to warm you up on a cold day or soothe a sore throat

Bottom line:  great food, fast & friendly service, good prices.
author: Ashley S.

description:
Slanted Door, meet your arch enemy. It's not uber-swanky Bong Su; it's the bely-warmin' home cooking of Aux Delice. Expect gourmet food without the price tag and without ostentation. Expect real Vietnamese food, and not Americanized fusion. Expect to get a table without making a reservation weeks in advance.

Recommendations: Pork spring rolls (superb dipping sauce and cool cucumber and carrot salad on the side). Then move onto the Bun Ga Xao, a deicious noodes with chicken dish.

And be sure to ask for a pot of tea.

My only quip is that there are no vegetabe site dishes. Could use a couple.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I should have expected that when my new neighbor, my landlord, the bartender at Rex's and some random girl at the coffee shop all gave rave reviews about this place and looked that their mouths were watering right then and there, that it would be good...better than good.  And it was.  

I had the garlic chicken.  HOLY COW!  That stuff was so good.  So flavorful.  Not greasy.  I had it for lunch, dinner, and lunch the next day.  Ha!  I savored every bite.  Can't wait to go back and try some pho!

The place is a tiny bit pricier than I would have expected, but par for the neighborhood.
author: Susan L.

description:
The food was pretty good, and I'd probably go here again, but it felt more like Chinese than Vietnamese. #49 (I think it was that one) was really yummy!

In terms of reservations, we booked less than 30 minutes before hand on a Friday night - pretty good if you ask me.
author: Kem K.

description:
A nice looking restaurant, designed almost like a thai restaurant but instead of thai girls and elephant wall art, they have dark blue tablets displaying girls in the traditional ao dai and rice picking hats. A large Buddha statue set near the front entrance, soft vietnamese music, and the smell of oriental incense creates tranquility in the room.

The food is all authentic Vietnamese. We had to order many dishes to fill up 6 stomaches. A favorite, boneless chicken wings covered in garlicky sticky sauce and beef curry served in a claypot.
author: Oanh N.

description: Went there on Tuesday night and I have to say I was pleased with our food.  We got the papaya salad with shrimp, the clay pot chicken, and the garlic noodles.  The noodles were great and full of flavor without being too overpowering with glaric.  The papaya salad was soo refreshing and crip and just had the right amount of heat to it.  The clay pot chicken was good, but a little on the sweet side.  Which is good but I could have it a bit more savory to help balance it out.  I would definifetly recommend this place!  Oh and the fried bananas with coconut ice cream was also devine, but then again I am impartial to coconut ice cream with real coconut bits in it!
author: Jubi N.

description:
This is our go to takeout Vietnamese place. The service is great and the food is also delicious.. though I always order the same thing (chicken with lemongrass and ginger) and so does my boyfriend (appetizer sampler platter). 

Also been here to eat a few times, and there's never a wait, the drink selection is decent, and it's great if you have a group!
author: Ams T.

description:
My dad was visiting me from Arkansas (yes, that's right, Arkansas) last weekend when we happened across Aux Delices. So we gave it a try....and were not disappointed. The vegetarian spring rolls were good, and the snapper and vegetable dish I ordered was good--although it could have been a little spicier.  The prices were reasonable...for the two of us it was less than $40 including tip. 

I'll definitely be back, especially when I don't feel the need to make the trek to the Ferry Building for Slanted Door.
author: Jenn G.

description:
A true standby.  We dine at Aux Delices at least once a month.  The family who runs it is so nice, and they deliver to us lickety-split!  
We always get some imperial rolls and the tamarind soup.  We frequently get the claypot salmon and the salt & pepper prawns.  It's always an affordable and pleasant experience.
author: Pamela D.

description:
I really hate giving places in my neighborhood this low of a rating, but yes, Aux Delices deserves it.

I've been here a few times and always been satisfied, but got take-out from here recently and was horribly disappointed.

We ordered the crispy chicken which is always a secure bet right?  Well this was the best part of our meal.  I will admit.  However, I thought the take-out portions were incredibly small especially for the $10 price.  

We also ordered the beef with ginger and lemon grass.  This was just horrible.  Small portions, not much flavor, and just not good.  I was severely disappointed.  Lastly, we had the "Jasmine Rice".  Let's not sugar coat it here.  It's white rice pure and simple.

Once again the food in Russian Hill is just not so hot unless you want to pay $$$ for your meal.  Quite unfortunate.  So I think I'll stick with Nicks and Za for a decent bang for the buck and I'll be staying away from this place...
author: Rachel S.

description:
The food was priced right (entrees $10) and the dark thai Beer that is not on the menu is fantastic. I'd recommend the sampler appetizer, lemongrass pork chops, seafood w. ginger ($12) ask for it spicy.

The bun dishes are okay.  The crepe and garlic noodles looked good but I didn't have any.

The service is slow which was fine because I was interested in a relaxing slow paced meal.  

The iced coffee was fantastic.  

If you can find parking go to this place.  The thai place across the street is also very good in case this place is crowded.
author: Mo P.

description: My favorite go to restaurant in my neighborhood and for take out. I love their vietnamese bun with pork, their beef pho is consistently good and well portioned with extra side mint leaves and sprouts, and their bo chari tai hot pot curry is delicious with brown rice. They typically get busy at night but I've never had a problem getting a seat. A plus is the service is fast, food within ten minutes from when you ordered. To go also takes 15 mins if you call in to pickup.  I also like to order the vietnamese crepes, the sampler platter that has their egg rolls and fresh rolls, and their chow mein (not thai but good for not being chinese). Try it if you are in the neighborhood! Average tab costs about 25 bucks for two with drinks, I get their thai ice tea or iced coffee.
author: SF Diner A.

description: I had the chicken porridge, spring rolls and shaken beef. Everything was yummy. The service was attentive and not disruptively so....And, yes I know it's hard to screw up fried bananas with coconut ice cream, so I'm not giving any huge props in this category, but OMG. SO delish!
author: Shira K.

description:
I hit Aux Delices with some friends when I was in town for a conference.  It took me a while to arrive as I took the bus but it was not a problem to find.  Of course I thought I was late but I was not the last one to arrive.  

The overall presentation is unassuming and we were waited on very soon after being seated.   We each got a dish and everyone sampled from the each entry.    I find this works best when there is a wide variety of dietary needs.   

The restaurant has an overall large menu with more than 65 items to select from.  The food was well prepared but the service was a tad slow at times as my water glass was empty more than once.. which is how I judge service. 

Overall, I don't think you can go wrong with Aux Delices or the food but there may be other places you want to try out first if you are on a limited or tight schedule.
author: G M.

description:
The food is pretty good and consistent over the years.
The waitress is always nice and sweet.
But I wonder each and every time I go there: why is the owner sooooo unhappy always?! A smile? A hello? A thank you? Something...
author: Elle H.

description:
You get served the Chao Ga - Chicken Rice Porridge (Thick chicken rice soup with ginger and scallions) during lunch as a starter.  It reminds me of soup that is served when you were sick as a child - but I really like it - seriously!

The sampler platter of imperial rolls, fresh spring rolls & steamed dumplings were also good.  

I really like the Bun Cha Gio - fresh vegetables, Vietnamese vermicelli and spring rolls.

Having visited Vietnam several times, I was looking for some of the more traditional cuisine that incorporates a lot of fresh vegetables and herbs.  I think Pagolac comes as close as it gets as far as I know.

There are still more items on this menu to explore.
author: Mic D.

description:
If you are in the area, give Aux Delices a try.  

Here is what I got on my most recent visit and could not have been more pleased:  

#17a Sampler platter
#16b Garlic noodles
#28 Cari xao (chicken curry)
#50 Bo Luc Lac (Filet mignon cubes)
Large Jasmine rice

The total bill for 4 people came to about $55.  

Very good Vietnamese food at a reasonable price for SF.
author: Jerome O.

description: Another great yelp find! After walking the city all they long we wanted to stay in for dinner and have delivery. So after checking yelp we decided on this place. And boy was it delicious!!! Beef with lemongrass, beef with caramel sauce, garlic noodles and the appetizer samples. It was fantastic. That's it, we are moving to San Francisco:)
author: Nicole F.

description:
I ordered  "BO XAO TOI" (beef sautéed with garlic over a bed of lettuce) for take out last week. When ordering, the staff was very helpful in determining what I would like the best.

The sauteed beef was a very solid dish- great flavor, tender beef, and cooked well. I was in the mood for something simple, tasty and delicious; this hit the spot.

Although a little expensive (and they charge extra for rice), it is worth it. Good portion, quality and flavor.  Will be back.
author: VL K.

description: I only tried the beef pho so I can't comment on anything but that. I was really disappointed. It was the smallest bowl of pho I have ever had, with only 3 or 4 pieces of beef. The broth tasted like a VERY SALTY chicken broth. I would not recommend coming here for pho.
author: E S.

description:
THIS POST WAS ACTUALLY MEANT FOR THE POTERO AVE LOCATION

Our favorites: Shrimp lemon soup, Pork and Shrimp Rolls, Imperial Rolls, Chicken Broccoli, BBQ Pork w/ Vermicelli.

We have only tried one thing we don't like: Vietnamese Pot Stickers (mushy).

Super fast delivery to Po-Hill. Always fresh and hot. This is our standard answer to "What should we have for dinner - I don't want to cook." Usually under $30 for 2 adults + 1 child (then there are leftovers too).
author: Sarah T.

description:
So the first time I came here was on a whim, walking down polk hungry for something different. we peaked at the menu and charged on in. start with the crepes, they rock! 
claypots are always good, as is everything else. I have returned a few times, you can;t beat the price, or the lack of the wait. maybe i shouldnt write this, as you might believe me and go, and then i will have to wait.
author: Rich B.

description:
Really good and consistent every time.

The staff is always super friendly (they even thought to put down a tablecloth underneath our toddler's highchair for the little mess she would make).

The parking is terrible on Polk Street and the meter maids and the SFPD is always out in force! (watch out for that left turn from Union onto Polk, it's a no-no and often a cop waits for offenders)

If I want good, inexpensive Vietnamese food I always return to Aux Delices.
author: J B.

description:
Wow, awesome.  I've eaten at a number of "meh" Vietnamese restaurants in SF, but this one was fantastic.  They had Cha Ca on the menu, which I actually had at its point of origin at this hole-in-the-wall in Hanoi, and didn't expect to see anywhere else.  And it was perfect!!

We also tried the Pho, which was quite good (though definitely upgraded in quality from most Pho I've had, which I have mixed feelings about since Pho feels to me like it should be a little street food-y).  

The desserts were fantastic... great friend bananas and excellent gelato.  The Vietnamese drip coffee was totally authentic as well, and really really good.

The service wasn't as good as it could have been... we were there almost 3 hours talking, and after dessert they stopped checking on us, which was a little annoying since we kept running out of water and had to flag someone down.  But during the meal they were quick and attentive, so maybe they were just trying to hint at us to leave.  =P

The atmosphere was calm and pleasant... it's definitely a place conducive to conversation.  No need to shout down people at the other tables; I don't think I overheard other conversations even once.  So if you're looking for a quiet and pleasant experience, this is the place.

Overall, it was a fantastic experience and I really look forward to taking some friends to try it out!
author: Graeme M.

description: I come here once a month and always order the same thing. The waitress knows me by order and doesn't even bother to ask me when I sit down.  It just comes right out and I feast.  This is one of my favorite neighborhood haunts and a place I always crave when I return from a trip.
author: Sarah C.

description:
First off, the parking around Polk and Green is horrible.  I mean the worse ever.  I was looking for parking in a 3 block radius on a weeknight  for about 20minutes until I found one.  Now if you can overlook the parking this restaurant is worthwhile.

It was really empty on a weeknight.  I heard it gets quite crowded but fortunately we found a day when there was no crowd.  We got seated in a booth with pillows at the end and cushions on the benches.  I thought it was a nice touch.  There were only 3 other tables occupied and there were two ladies next to us that were very loud, you could only imagine how much louder it would be with more people.  

So we ordered a sampler tray for starters.  It has Imperial Rolls, Dumplings, and Spring Rolls.  The Imperial Rolls and Spring Rolls were good, but nothing out of the ordinary.  The Dumplings were  odd to me and it was my first time tasting it.  It reminded me of Dim Sum, and basically was a noodle with ground beef inside.

For dinner we ordered a clay pot of pork and shrimp in a caramel sauce (Heo Va Tom Kho).  This was really good! The meat was very tender but not chewy.  The sauce was so good, I kept throwing it over my bowl of rice.  I would have been happy with 2 orders.  The other dish we ordered was (Bo Luc Lac) Beef filet mignon cubes lightly sauteed with garlic.  When my friend ordered it, I didn't know what to think, but when I tasted it.  Wow, the flavor really hits you as well as the tenderness of the meat.  

The price is very reasonable for two people at dinner.  The portions were just right and filling enough for us, but not enough to skip dessert.  We decided to get dessert elsewhere but with time running out and us getting tired we ended up retiring for the night.  

I really enjoyed having dinner here and will most likely come back to try some of their other dishes and maybe improve their rating but if you are teetering whether or not to go here, I recommend you do.  Just remember that finding parking is a huge hassle, but if you can overlook that minor setback, you will be in for a treat.  4-4.5 stars for sure.
author: ed c.

description:
I've been here twice and have loved everything we've ordered both times.  Not to mention the prices are very cheap for the amount of food you get.  The second time, I was with a large group of girls and we seriously ordered half of the menu.  I'm not lying when I say EVERY SINGLE THING we ordered was delicious.  Some favorites were the sugar cane prawns, caramel salmon, crispy chicken and garlic noodles.

OH.  And if you're in the mood for a cocktail, I highly recommend the lycheetini.  DELICIOUS!
author: Christine C.

description:
Found this place after a disappointing meal at La Folie (it's located directly across the street)

I have to say the only positive thing about my dining experience at La Folie was finding Aux Delices.  We went to Aux Delices the next night and it was suprisingly good for a Vietnamese restaurant with mostly white patrons.

The soups were authentic and very tasty (PHO and the CANH CHUA.)   Dumplings are defintely worth trying.  Entrees are solid too, but the soup is their best dish i think.  prices were also incredibly reasonable for the location.  Just slightly more pricey than a typical vietnamese restaurant in Little Saigon.

Definitely going back!
author: jeff l.

description:
The beef broth for the pho was some of the best I've had in a long, long time. The rest of the food is pretty damned excellent. 

Minus two stars for charging $3.50 for a small bowl of rice at a Vietnamese restaurant.
author: Max B.

description: This has been my favorite Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco for close to 10 years now.  This place is somewhere in between the a fancy restaurant and those hole in the wall Vietnamese restaurants where you will find amazing food but definitely a nice place to sit down and enjoy your food.  There is no reason to eat at a restaurant like The Slanted Door for Vietnamese food.  This is all you need and the food is as good as it gets.
author: Nathan V.

description: Food is good, not as great as I woukd expect but service is horrible. I would rather serve myself than be served by waitress who constantly ignores you. I felt that I had to beg to be served and for them to remove all the empty plates that overcrowds the table. they were however prompt in charging you 17% service charge AFTER TAX! I would not had given any tip if I wasnt with the group.
author: Richard L.

description:
i was feeling under the weather so i donned on a hoodie and walked to get some food and fresh air.

in the past, i've enjoyed a few bowls of pho at aux delice but i always crave some homey chicken rice porridge when i'm sniffly.
their version was filled with chunks of chicken and ginger.  

the goi cuon spring rolls were ok but i feel that their cha gio imperial rolls were superior.  another nice app was the green papaya salad which was light, crispy, and nicely spiced.

overall a friendly family run neighborhood spot.
author: Anh V.

description: Came here for dinner around 9:30pm on Monday night.  The place was relatively empty, but that might be because they close at 10 pm.  I ordered the bun with grilled lemongrass steak (noodles and fish sauce) which was very good with very tender steak.   My friends ordered the Vietnamese ice coffee and bun with grilled pork and soup with tofu.  The prices were pretty cheap-- about $10-11 bucks per dish (but not as cheap as Little Saigon).  The service was very fast and friendly as well.  Definitely a good place to eat if you are in the neighborhood and in the mood for Vietnamese/asian food.
author: Leslie C.

description:
This place is pretty damn good.  I go about 1-2x a month.  It's very afordable and the staff is friendly.  Could pick it up a notch on the service, but, the food is good.  When ever I order, I have enough to take back to work for lunch the next day.  LOVE THAT!  :)  Try it out... get the lemon grass noodles with the beef.  You'll enjoy, I promise!  If you don't, get your taste buds checked!

Thank you.
author: Noneya B.

description: This place is one of  the best Vietnamese food places I've ever been to.They do take out and delivery depending on where you live and everything on the menu is fresh and delicious. They even have a vegetarian menu and you can substitute brown rice for white rice which is very cool for an Asian restaurant.
author: Alexandria U.

description: Apparently, we got the extra special service, worse experience ever.
author: Bassets B.

description: Enjoyed the shaking filet mignon and glass noodles with seafood.
author: g s.

description: Place is pretty legit! Prices are a little high but overall pretty tasty food
author: Pan P.

description:
Mmmm.... imperial rolls, garlic noodles, barbecue pork. How do they do it? I don't really care as long as I get to eat it when I want to. And since this place is right around the corner from me, I pretty much can. 

Aux Delices has an extensive menu so no matter what your taste buds desire, you will undoubtedly find something here to satiate them. 

If you dine in, they also have a pretty decent wine list so drink up!
author: Aimée G.

description: One of my favorite restaurants. The food is delicately prepared. One of my favorite things to get is the grilled eggplant appetizer. Everyone loves it!
author: Christie S.

description: This is a review purely for the delivery. I moved to the "TenderNob" area about a year ago and have been searching for a great Vietnamese place for takeout/delivery on those nights I just don't feel like cooking. Found it! The Sampler Platter w/ imperial rolls, fresh spring rolls and dumplings is fantastic. I was very impressed with the flavorful sauces and ample serving of fresh herbs (cilantro, mint, etc.) Also ordered the Ga Kho (Chicken in a caramel sauce) and really enjoyed it with some jasmine steamed rice. Delivery was very fast, too! Always a bonus. Can't wait to dine in at this restaurant. Also having a roof party this summer and considering ordering food from Aux Delices instead of cooking! The price is a bit more than other Asian style places in the area that deliver, but it's completely worth it.
author: Jessica M.

description: Menu is packed full of MSG.  Acoustics aren't that great, you have to repeat yourself three times before the waiter will understand you.  Kind of a nice interior and good selection, assuming you like eating MSG.
author: Anon A.

description:
yum! I went here last Saturday at 7ish with my boyfriend and there was no wait. 

We had the imperial rolls to start, very tasty and a good portion.

For dinner he had the beef satay, which again was a good portion and tasty. I had the sauteed broccoli with chicken, it was definitely not as much volume of food as the noodle dish, but that was just what I wanted. I also got a side of brown rice, but when I go back, I will probably skip that. If you want a light meal - get one of the meat dishes without an additional side. If you want a more filling meal, get a noodle/rice dish, or else a side with your meal.

I will definitely go back: my meal was tasty and a good value!

Also, they were VERY good about filling the water glasses!

For groups... I would guess they could handle/fit a group of up to 10 well.
author: Caitlin B.

description: Solid Vietnamese food, good service, quick takeout.  Garlic noodles...mmmmmmm.
author: Jen C.

description: Discovered this place through Yelp while in the Polk St. area.  Amazing food.  I was with three friends and we all ordered different dishes and there was not a bad tasting one in the mix!  Definitely eat here if you are in the area.
author: Mia M.

description:
This is a good place to eat. I've been going there for years.

The vegetarian spring rolls  (goi cuon chay) and the vegetable curry (rau xao cari) are surprisingly good. Their chao ga is also good. Although I'm a little bummed at the amount of ginger in it since I'm not a fan of the cursed root. 

Not only are the dishes good, but the owners are really nice. They even let me order an item that is not listed on the menu.

But for as much as I like the place ... if you like Vietnamese iced coffee, I'd pass on it here.
author: Mobile B.

description:
If you want authentic Vietnamese food and don't want to spend a fortune at trendy eateries in the city that charge a premium: this low key restaurant on Polk street is a great compromise! 

The spicy shrimp soup with pineapple and tomato was simply outstanding! Piping hot roasted white fish with dill served in a clay pot was both beautifully executed and delicious! Duck in l'orange sauce contained good quality duck breast but could have used bit more sauce.

Overall: the quality/price ratio is GREAT!
author: justin g.

description:
Delicious, moderately priced food. Good wine list. Always friendly staff and impeccably clean facility. 

My favorites include the garlic noodles and the fish in dill served with lettuce and noodles. The food is simple, fresh, and exquisitely prepared. 

A lovely place to go regularly or as a special meal.

I have no idea what the other reviewer was writing about when he/she said no Asians ate here. That's ridiculous.
author: Bubbles L.

description:
Went on a Saturday and the service was slow. Most likely a proximity issue since we were seated near the front, away from the kitchen.

That aside, the food was banging. From the egg/spring rolls to the papaya salad to the lemongrass porkchops to the shaken beef - I was impressed. The price was reasonable for the quality. I'll have to check out the pho next time.

If only they served take-out bahn mi at 3am.
author: nick w.

description:
Our version of the "Chinese Takeout" (not literally) is the Crab/Prawn Noodles and Garlic Noodles and the, I'm going to let you in on a big secret - you mix the two together. YUMMY doughy goodness. 

Other dishes there are good too - vegetarian summer rolls (non-fried), noodle salad (I had the lemongrass tofu). They have really good soups as well. All in all, really great comfort food. Plus, they deliver!
author: jcie k.

description: Tasty appetizers and better than average bun made for a tasty meal here. The food isnt quite the authentic experience you'll find in the chinatown area but might be a bit more approachable to some. Combined with a very nice well maintained interior and surprisingly reasonable prices means I would definitely dine here again.
author: Daniel T.

description:
YUM!
Taking a break from studying for finals, I decided I needed (and deserved) some delicious comfort food, something preferably hot (due to the cold, rainy day we're presently having).  When I don't know what I want, I usually turn to Yelp and check out top delivery places requested by you lovely yelpers.  What sparked my interest?? Pho! Yes, warm noodley pho... yum!
So I decided to try out Aux Delices as result of the mostly positive reviews and the fact that it's so close.  It was definitely a good choice... the only drawback is the $20 minimum for delivery which is hard to reach for one person. But now I have a lovely (huge) green salad that I can eat for lunch tomorrow!
For dinner, I decided on the vegetarian spring rolls and the chicken pho. Both were so delicious! The spring rolls are basically filled with fresh veggies and noodles, and then wrapped in greens and thin sticky rice paper and is served with a clear-ish sweet sauce.  Some places tend to use mint in their spring rolls (which I'm not a huge fan of) but these did not, I wasn't starving, so I only planned on eating one of them, but they were so good that I would be lying if I said I didn't eat both :)
The chicken pho definitely hit the spot, my mouth is still tingling from the jalapenos and sriracha (I heart spicy food). The medium order is quite large for one person, so I definitely have more for tomorrow, so nice to be able to get several meals out of one order!  My only complaint about my order was they didn't provide chopsticks! It's just not the same using a fork and spoon to eat Pho... next time I'll definitely make sure to request some.
Another plus is that they originally said 35 minutes, and I'm positive it was only about 10 from the time I called. Overall the food was delicious and I will definitely be ordering from them again in the near future.
author: Emily S.

description: Great Pho, spring rolls, claypots, shaking beef, wine selection. This spot is top notch. Don't wanna ruin it for you, just check it out if you are into Vietnamese-french fusion...super yummy!
author: Brittany T.

description: I would give this place zero stars if I could. I went here with my service dog for dinner, the hostess who called herself the manager was very rude as soon as she saw the dog, and said we had to leave, despite the legal paperwork that I showed. Another man from the open kitchen then said "we have the right to refuse anyone we like, I can tell the police you guys are drunk or on drugs." I asked for his name and he said "johnny cash" and laughed in our faces. I called the police and they came to the scene, This was straight discrimination, no one should ever go to this restaurant. What they did was illegal, and unprofessional.
author: Sara F.

description: I like that they had veggie options here. They also tasted good too. I like it but it's a bit fancy for what I like to see from vietnamese food. Some of there dishes are a bit pricey too. 20 dollars for beef which doesn't include rice. hmmm... What normal person is gonna eat a plate of meat with no rice?
author: Ryan N.

description: been here twice now and the food was great both times. everything we got was good, seriously. the service kinda sucked both times, but ill let it slide since the food was good, and i have yet to experience THAT great of service in SF. pretty good ambiance for a vietnamese restaurant, and a good date spot for a friday or saturday night. you can usually get a table last minute, which was great for us, since we were planning on going to leopolds where there was a 1.5 hour wait (no thanks!)
author: Erica D.

description: MMMMmmm....I love this place! I order take-out all the time (they deliver too) and I come in occasionally for lunch.  Good food, good prices.  One of my favorite places for Vietnamese!
author: Devin W.

description: White table cloths, soft music, good service and excellent food. What more can you ask for? We shared the tamarind lemongrass soup which was $8.00 for a vegetarian. It was very flavorful.  Then we had the chicken caramel claypot. Yes, caramel, but it was very tasty. No veggies in the clay pot so we ordered the vegetarian curry, which balanced out the flavors of the curry. A small rice is the size of a rice bowl and a large rice is like 6 times as big, but not six times the price (go for that). Definitely want to come here again or get their takeout. They are on delivery.com and I saw a lot of deliveries go out.
author: Natalie S.

description: This was a big surprise. I had never heard of the place but went there randomly. Great food, good bang for the buck.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Four of us - - not 14, and not 44.... just four of us went here for dinner.
 
It took a minimum of 20, perhaps even 30 minutes to have someone come and even ask us if we wanted anything to drink, never mind taking our order.  No apologies, no excuses - - no nothing.  "Do you know what you want?" was pretty much how we were greeted after 30 minutes of waiting... silently.  
Now to think of it, they didn't even greet us when we walked in.
 
Was it crowded, you ask?
No.
Were they understaffed?
No.
 
I don't KNOW why.  It was four people in a perfectly lighted booth and not a single person came by during all that time to even LIE that they'd be back to take an order.
 
Then the drinks and food were finally brought out.
 
We ordered a soup which came out rather lukewarm and tasteless,  BLAND.
We ordered a pork chop - - - it was like pork with galbi marinade.... mediocre at best.  Too sweet.  Funny that I ordered the pork w/ lemongrass.
We ordered a shaking beef type of thing  --  allegedly filet mignon.  Mediocre - - nothing notable about this dish and not worthy of the highest priced item we ordered at $17.
We ordered garlic noodles - - unimpressive again.  Bland, tasteless, but amongst its peers on this night, it came in second.
We ordered the only crab they had on the menu - - offered at market price.  It was covered in something and then deep fried - - too dry, no flavor once you got to the meat, and totally messy.  The latter was more our problem than the restaurant's - - but all in all, this dish was not worthwhile.
We ordered the duck -  and this was perhaps the best of all, and it also - - like the others, hovered within mediocrity.
 
We asked how the duck was - - his answer was:  "It's made in an orange liquor."
NOT quite what we asked, but OK.  What a salesguy.
 
Then a woman server brings the coffee order over.  I had ordered an iced coffee while my girlfriend was having it hot.
She asked if we'd ever had Vietnamese coffee before, and we said yes.  I took the chance to remind her I had ordered an iced coffee - - can I get a glass of ice to go with this coffee, please....
Her answer:  "I'm going to bring it, I only have two hands."
(NO - she didn't...  oh yes, she did.)
"I see that."  (Thinking to self:  invest in a f%&^&*$ TRAY, woman, it's a damned restaurant!)
 
Service sucked.
Parking was impossible, no valet - - and typical Polk Street mess, even on a Tuesday evening.  Wine list was unimpressive... but they did have at least one of all the common varietals.
Total was $160 including  tip, breaking down to $40pp.  I'd have rather spent double and eaten somewhere good, or one quarter and had a feast at In N Out.
 
Food was somewhat edible, but with Bong Su, Slanted Door, or THE HOUSE in existence, or even Crustacean or PPK for crab and garlic noodles  - there is no conceivable reason that I'd ever eat here again.
 
Totally unacceptable.
And I will never understand how y'all are giving this place 4-5 stars.
author: Grace K.

description:
canh chua (tamarind soup w/ shrimp) - not sour enough & was nothing special...almost didn't taste like canh chua

salmon clay pot - tasty but i've had better w/ catfish clay pot

banh xeo - fried egg flour wrap w/ pork & shrimp - very oily & i've also had better

bill was about $32. not bad at all.

the only thing that i liked about this place is how clean & fancy they make it. the food wasn't that great since i've experienced much better from mom & pop shops where the food is more like real vietnamese home cookin'. they were also very nice to accommodate my friend and i who were running late for dinner and came in just 5 minutes before they close at 10pm. i also noticed that this restaurant is listed under the vietnamese/french category....i dont think i noticed anything french about it?

overall i grade the food 2 stars & service 4 stars = 3 stars
author: Rosalynn D.

description: This place has good solid, Vietnamese dishes at good prices.  Nice quiet place in a good hood.  It's several steps up from the Vietnamese sandwich places around Civic Center, and not the high end of the spectrum, The Slanted Door.
author: R F.

description:
The food here is good and a little different than what you get at a lot of other vietnamese places in the city.

Their sticky chicken is really really yummy. I
The staff is also very nice and attentive. 

I live around here and can attest to the lack of good restaurants on the north of broadway polk strip. Aux Delices is a rare spot that has good and affordable food and service.
author: Sam H.

description: I was craving pho (yet again), so my boyfriend and I decided to expand our horizons and head down to Aux Delices for some Vietnamese (great reviews and reasonable prices made it an enticing option). When we walked in we were immediately impressed. The decor and overall ambiance is not what you typically associate with a Vietnamese restaurant -- really nice with an intimate vibe. We sat down and nearly immediately ordered our regular -- fresh spring rolls to start and bowls of soup. Not 3 minutes after ordering did we look around and have pre-dinner food envy -- why, oh why, did we order PHO?! Don't get me wrong, I love a solid noodle soup and Aux Delices' pho does not fail to impress, but their other options looked amazing! I'll have to review this place again after our next visit (there will be another, I'm sure), but I get the feeling that Aux Delices is the place you go for solid Vietnamese food whereas the hole-in-the-wall shops are the better options when you're just looking for a no-frills huge bowl of pho. Good service, good food and reasonable prices. Definitely a solid choice if you're looking for some fresh Asian cuisine!
author: Shannon E.

description: I first started coming here as a highschooler because I know the owner's son.  So excuse me if you think my review is a bit biased, but trust me, its not!!!!   I remember going away to college and always craving their garlic chicken...MMMMMmmmm.... now that I don't live very far, I can have it whenever I want!  Aux Delices has quite an extensive menu and never have I had anything that wasn't good.  My recommendations are the chicken in the sweet spicy garlic sauce and the caramel salmon.  Deeelicious!  If you're looking for a cute place to go with great food and that also won't cost you an arm and a leg, I highly suggest giving the spot a shot!
author: laura q.

description:
Two words: comfort food.

i mean, i love vietnamese food any day of the week, rain or shine...but a hot, spicy, delicious bowl of beef pho just tastes extra good when it's cold and rainy and you need a place to dry your wet feet.

the restaurant is quiet and pleasant, the service is quick and attentive.

i recommend this for two: large beef pho (extra jalepenos, of course. also, they're not stingy with the bean sprouts which for me, is a huge plus); pork and prawns in the caramel pot (yum!); garlic noodles. it'll fill you up, warm you up, and leave you totally happy. promise.

was it the best meal of my life? no. was it some of the best pho i've had in the city? yes. will i be back for more? you betcha.
author: Cameron J.

description: YUMMITY YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM!!!  We must've gone a good night 'cause everything they served was mutherfuckmin good!!!! Started with a starter.  Actually, the mother of all starters, THE SAMPLER.  Imperial rolls, charbroiled pork, summer rolls, and some rice noodle wrap thing with 2 dipping sauces.  All very tasty and yes! not too greazy (like my jerry curl). I got the crispy chicken in a sticky sweet sauce, and E-dub got some healthy looking veggie dish.  Both were unbelievable and the servers had to snatch the dishes with our tongues still licking the plates. JK!  But I did wish I had more room in my tummy to finish every last speck of our tasty grub.  Don't get the fried fruit for dessert though.  Bob's Donuts has better fare.
author: Joyhan S.

description: Yummy.  The pho is the best on Russian Hill by far.  Even though I have a tendency to numb my mouth with srirachoa sauce and have tears oozing from my eyes, I'm sure it was delicious.  All of the ingredients were fresh and you can get a killer lychee martini complete with whole lychee fruit floating in the glass.  There were about 9 of us and everyone liked what they got.  We had plenty of sake, beer, appetizers, pho and some random main dishes and the bill came to $25 each...Bargain for a big group dinner in a restaurant with table cloths!
author: ellyk E.

description: Look I don't know how to say either of those 2 words up there. Does that matter? It does not. What does matter is that everything on this menu (fine, I tried like 8 things on this menu. That is still a plenty good representative sample. Stop giving me crap.) is awwesomely delicious, which is incidentally, how I say the restaurant's name in my head so I have something to say in my head instead of the garbeldy gook that Charlie Brown's elders used to speak. Actually, I just learned from J.K. Rowling that garbeldy gook is a real language. For goblins. Weird, right? So Charlie Brown's elders didn't speak it then. Probably.
author: Shannon V.

description:
i didnt eat at the actual restaurant but i did order takeout and it was tasty!  i was really impressed - both affordable and quick too.  they have a $20 minimum for delivery but i didnt find that difficult to hit.  i dont think that they deliver everywhere, but i live pretty close by so they had no problem delivering to me.  
i had the imperial rolls (which reminded me a lot of the crispy rolls at little thai, also a favorite) and the chicken with mixed vegetables in spicy garlic sauce, with jasmine rice.  i thought the portions were just right for leftovers, but not too big.  there were lots of entrees that appealed to me, cant wait to try more!
author: Carolyn B.

description: Wow!!!  I can't believe it took me six years to get in here!  All of the dishes we had were fantastic.  Everything tasted fresh and clean.  There was not one bit of extra grease on the fried rolls, and the fresh rolls were jam packed with tasty veggies.  Not only but also, they have sake, a decent wine list (compared to most vietnamese places it is fantastic), and the whole family working the house.  This is my new fave vietnamese!!
author: Amme P.

description: Currently my favorite Vietnamese restaurant. The food and service are consistently excellent. I love the fresh rolls and the pork and shrimp skewers, but I you can't really go wrong here. The soups are great. Also, try the chicken and rice porridge--it's flavored with fresh ginger and will leave you wanting more. Did I mention the garlic noodles and the appetizer sampler?
author: Rafa R.

description: Au Delices is wonderful!  At the waitress's suggestion, I ordered the catfish grilled in a clay pot with fresh dill, green onion, and carmelized onions.  The fish came with a plate of noodes, fresh lettuce, cucumber, and carrots, and was an INCREDIBLE combination of flavors and textures.  Light, refreshing, and delicious!
author: Alanna C.

description: This little Vietnamese place is delicious. Very fresh, clean tasting food, that never weighs you down. Not sure if they take reservations, but I've never had to wait more than a few minutes for a table. Service is always solid, as is the classic menu. Beer/wine only.
author: Michael C.

description:
Vietnamese is the new Thai in case you haven't heard.
Originally we wanted to check out Pagolac, but it was closed on Mon, so the ms found this place.
A bit out of the way for us SoMa goers, but at 630pm we hoped to be able to find parking and not get towed (with all those obscure SF parking rules)
Having not really been immersed in Viet food before, there was a bit of a deer-in-the-headlights panic on what to order, after all I was hankerin' for some food
A sampler app platter, 2 dishes, a glass of wine and $50 (incl tip) later our bellies were full, but in a light and refreshing way
They tried to make the place nice looking inside with some fabric hanging from the ceiling and whatnot, but the puke colored walls still reminded one that this was like an over glorified Chinese restaurant.
A bit chilly inside and the music was too low--meaning you could hear other's conversations
Eventually more people came in so it got a little noisier
Only other critique is that our server spoke very poor English plus she was a mumbler and low talker, so all we did was nod and smile
We'd definitely go back, just wish it wasn't so far away
author: G K.

description:
the food was pretty tasty, but at the same time, everything was shiny from all the oil they used.

service was extremely slow for our group of 5, and they included 18% gratuity which i do not appreciate.
author: shaun l.

description: amazing place, my cousin uses all the time for private functions.
author: Vikram C.

description:
I was a little bumbed on the experience.  Maybe I didn't order well or something.  Really wanted to like it, but just wasn't feeling the food, service, and vibe in there.

the neighborhood is awesome though, and I think this place does bring something to the table on polk- just not for me.

I'll go back if someone else is buying
author: Nick H.

description: As close as you can get to Mom's home cookin'! This place was still packed after 9pm on Saturday! Every table was taken and there was even a wait. Good thing we made reservations! It's def. my version of a "hole in the wall"  resto - cheap but clean! :D We started off with the Canh Chua - a little on the salty side but good nonetheless. It came with either shrimp or chicken. I prefer mine with catfish. Next was the Tom Chanh - with these types of salads it usually depends on how well they make the fish sauce. Perfect combo! The suon nuong xa was great as well. Lastly, the dish that brought me back to my childhood - garlic noodles! Reminded me of when my Mom would cook macaroni with a dab of soy sauce and butter. Yummm...... Can't wait to come back and try the famous Cha ca!
author: Cheryl P.

description: Started out with the Papaya and shrimp salad, very spicy with lots of jalapeno peppers and very good. We also had the filet mignon (that was cubed and served with a nice soy based dipping sauce) and the bbq pork with crispy imperial rolls and fried rice. Everything was cooked perfectly but the filet was the standout followed closely by the bbq pork. The prices are also extremely reasonable...
author: Nicolas H.

description: along polk and below russian hills...a parking nightmare for "nicer" vietnamese...indulging in little beer and a bottle of wine to share...two choices for pho...pho tai (beef) and pho ga (chicken), and requesting both...small bowls and ladle provided for easy sharing...broth clean and clear, but bit potent with vietnamese fish sauce flavors lingering heavy in both broth...appetizer of fried egg rolls quite standard and served on typical platter of a la carte lettuce, noodles and sweetened fish sauce dip...same for egg rolls and finding no difference from elsewhere...dip in sweet peanut sauce and filling...bbq pork plate and finding nice leaner cuts of pork, and flavors fine...but, finding leaner pork resulting in dryer tougher meat...an order of fried chicken pieces concoction and finding too sweet...overall $thirty per person dinner for average vietnamese in "nicer" russian hills facade...
author: Hen A.

description:
friends....I'm a russian hill (flats) denizen ...
and I can safely say that in addition to their regular great menu...they
have THE best Steak in the hood....prepared in garlic butter...with
awesome, wholesome vegetables as the side dish....
Check them out
author: david f.

description: The fresh spring rolls (I puchased both vegetarian and meat to try) were so delicious I ate them in the car, and they never made it home.
author: Margaret L.

description: This is one of my favorite Vietnamese/French restaurant. Aux Delices means "At the Delights". I love their carmel salmon. It's sweet and has a bit of spice in it. It's yummmmmy!!! Everything on their menu is superb. If you like beef, try their Bu Luc Lac. Parking sucks but it's worth it.
author: Elms M.

description:
this place is so good

really great food at a great price

great location, perfect for a date or family

take is awesome too, the delivery boy is cute as well
author: Jon L.

description:
Really enjoyed the vegetable curry and the vegetarian noodle dish (both with fresh tofu).  Everything tasted fresh and they accomodated our vegetarian, gluten free needs.
Very inexpensive too.
author: Sunil S.

description: I used to live on Polk Street so it was an easy walk to some of my favorite food. I have since moved to the Marina and I still get regular cravings for Aux Delices. :) They have really yummy Beef Noodle Soup, as well as a killer Vietnamese Crepe (I eat this as a meal because it is sooo good). The pork and rolls combo noodle salad is also really great-it's yummy and filling, AND I leave happy because I had a "salad" for dinner which makes me feel healthy-Hehe! My boyfriend usually gets the shaken filet mignon cubes sauteed with garlic which are excellent- flavorful and tender. The owners are really nice as well. Their daughter helped out at the restaurant for years and is super nice. It's one of those places where you go for good food and leave happy and satisfied without sending a lot of money. :) I highly recommend Aux Delices!
author: Alexia P.

description:
The food here is solid & consistent. Great flavors, good lite options, as well as some heavy, scrumptious indulgences. The ingredients & meat are high quality, and they have great refreshing salads and soups. 

Recommend the Clay Pot Caramel Chicken, the pancake appetizer, garlic noodles (must be a garlic-lover for this), veggie curry, and the soup w/ pineapples in it.

Definitely go here the next time you're in the mood for Asian food, packed with unique flavors.

*** Note: the ambiance is more of a family / group style restaurants, so I wouldn't recommend for a romantic dinner out.
author: Rini R.

description: The crab and asparagus soup is good. The noodles with seafood is really good. The crunchy chicken is excellent.
