author: Christopher L.

description: Last night in San Francisco and had dinner here.  I had never had Vietnamese food before and discovered that I love it.  Can't wait to come back to this neighborhood again.
author: Karin B.

description: Very tasty curried veggies with tofu.  Pretty atmosphere makes you think you should be paying more than you really are.  The only hiccup of the evening was the glass of wine they first brought me - it tasted as though it had been open for a few days [which is odd as they tout themselves as a resturant & wine bar].  However, the server was more than happy to bring me another glass, which was just fine.  Definitely a repeat for me.
author: Beth G.

description: Food was good, ambiance even better...only bummer was one the girls in our party was vegetarian and so our waitress told us that she'd bring out vegetarian platter for appetizers but when it came out, 1/3 of the appetizers was vegetarian spring rolls...everything else had pork and chicken.  Leftovers are awesome...I think I drank too much catching up with old friends...vietnamese beer rocks.
author: Shel D.

description: If you've never tried Vietnamese food before, here's a great introduction.I love the porridge, salt & pepper prawns, spicy seafood soup and claypot fish! They can make it as spicy as you'd like and they're very accommodating! You have to go for some cafe sua da (Vietnamese Iced Coffee) at the end of the meal. I miss my Vietnamese food and when I'm craving some yummy home cookin' I head over here.
author: flo t.

description: I have to say.. really really yummy pho. menu could use a shift or some specials but all in all this place is solid. the fish in iron pot with fresh dill is divine as well.
author: Jayne M.

description: Overhyped place - the food is strictly ok, the service is below par. We recently celebrated a friend's birthday here...the person taking our reservation made a big fuss about ordering a pre-set menu or a minimum per person, and how busy the restaurant was. The place was definitely not busy on a Saturday night. The server counted the number of entrees we ordered (2 less than number of people, though there was enough sake) and kept trying to get us to order more...usually, we tend to order a second round based on what we like, and thought she was being too pushy. The Garlic noodles were good - the rest of the food was nothing spectacular....standard fare. I've had better Bun noodle salad with Imperial Rolls at Sunflower in the Mission, and better Summer Rolls at Yamo.  Their attitude seemed to visibly change after we ordered more food...how ridiculous is that?
author: Shweta V.

description: Ordered delivery here one night trusting Yelpers' reviews...  And they do not lead u astray!  Bf and I ordered 2 large bowls of chicken pho (we should have gotten mediums, larges are really large) and a summer roll.  Order came in 20 mins (they originally told us 35-40mins) and food was super fresh and flavorful  :)  We're adding this to our regular rotation for sure!
author: Stephanie P.

description: Delicious! I came here on 4th of July two years ago and ordered a lettuce crepe. It was fresh and crunchy, and the sauce adds to the yummy factor.
author: Tina C.

description: Okay, but a bit pricey.  The $4 for a pot of Tea is absurd!
author: Sparky W.

description: This is the best food ever: fresh, clear flavor, quality ingredients. I eat at Aux Delices as often as I can, and I wish it were more often. My favorite currently is bbq chicken, sauteed broccoli and brown rice. I always get the rice porridge (chicken, ginger, rich rice broth and some onions for clarity) if I need a health boost that is comforting. Never fails. The pho is genius, but my all-time faves are shaken beef and the Imperial rolls. You cannot go wrong here. They treat me like family here, and I love them right back.
author: Carla H.

description: Walked in here when the restaurant we were going to go to was closed.  It wasn't too crowded on a Friday night, but the food was good and not too expensive.  Service was quick so we had plenty of time to catch the movie we wanted to see and we left feeling full.
author: Kris L.

description: Garlic noodle is yummy and their vietnamese spring roll is actually pretty good, but if you want real authentic Vietnamese food, the TL is a much better place and cheaper too.  Aux Delices is more of a high end vietnamese place, so if you don't know too much about vietname food, this is a good place to try.  Real vietnamese places rarely have service and they barely speak English.  Know you're stuff and then go to the ghetto places to eat.. you'll love it.
author: AhLin C.

description: I went here once awhile back and was excited to go back because this place is soooo yummy.  This is what I was talking about when I said there are Vietnamese places to eat at which are much cheaper than Out the Door that are just as good.  My favorite dishes here are the caramel chicken, noodle salad w/chicken, sampler platter and glass noodles w/crab and shrimp.  I was here on Friday with three friends and we ordered four entrees and the sampler platter and it only turned out to be $17 each!  Can't wait to go back and try some other things on the menu since it all sounds delish.
author: Rosie F.

description: Eaten here a thousand times an just love this place. Everything on the menu is fantastic and the service is great. Five stars don't come easy!
author: james j.

description:
one of my top 3 favorite vietnamese restaurants!!  great family restaurant!!!! have been dining here for about 3 years now. i even had my wedding reception here & they catered my birthday last year.  my family & friends always rave about the food.  the nguyen family always make me feel at home.........
its a nice warm cozy atmosphere, great booth seating.........

the food is consistently delicious............

my regular order -- a great crowd pleaser unless your vegetarian:
 - lychee martini -- yummee
 - papaya salad -- nice spicy kick with shrimps
 - bbq lemongrass beef skewers --sooooo good
 - crispy chicken sauteed in sweet, spicy, garlic sticky sauce --nguyen  family original recipe  -- amazing
- caramel salmon claypot -- tender, sweet , slightly spicy
- garlic noodles -- uses fresh garlic & basil sooo good
- jasmine rice
author: Cindi N.

description: The food is okay, not too good to my standard.  I really like the bbq beef (bo lui), that's why I gave this place 4 stars, I would give it 3 otherwise :).  The charbroiled pork is okay, the bbq chicken is not good.  The egg rolls (cha gio) was okay.
author: Lily K.

description: On my current quest to find more affordable restaurants, Aux Delices was a fantastic find. Awesome food, and great service. The ambiance is a little cheesy, but it didn't diminish from the overall experience. We had a sampler platter of appetizers...the spring rolls were probably my favorite. I had the carmel chicken, which was just as good as it sounds. We had a hard time deciding on a wine, and our waitress was kind enough to bring out a few tastings so we made the right choice. Nice touch. I think I found a new neighborhood favorite!
author: Brianne K.

description:
Went here with friends last week and boy was it yummy.  First off I should mention I am not a fan of Vietnamese for but their garlic noodles rocked my world.  I went with 3 friends, half us us veggies and half meat eaters and everyone was satisfied.  I had veggies and rice as well as vegetable soup.  I could take or leave the soup but the vegetables were delicious, they tasted very fresh.  
The decor was calming with light colors and soft lighting.  Our waiter was attentive but unobtrusive.  We sat in a booth with high sides which made it feel private, I thought it was charming.   The prices seemed reasonable and my very favorite: it's quiet.  I actually could speak at a normal level and so could my friends and no one had to say "what" over and over, I appreciate that a lot.
Also I hear they deliver- you can't beat that.
I just learned that there is a new location in my hood- the Mission, I am looking forward to checking it out.
author: Kaylee T.

description: A hidden gem for a 2-3 times a month dinner spot.  Great food, good prices and a nice atmosphere.  *Bonus points for healthy options, and they deliver too!
author: Jay C.

description: Wow!! What an amazing restaurant. The atmosphere is quiet and relaxing. The family who runs aux is so nice, and all their orginal vietnamese recipes are unbelievable. Since I live around the corner, I have to honestly say that I have almost tried everything on the menu. For the perfect order I would recommend the #7 soup , the sugar cane roll appetizer, shrimp and pork in a clay pot or salmon in a clay pot, lemongrass BBQ shrimp and beef, and the shaking beef filet's. I promise you will not be disappointed.
author: Sarah S.

description: Aux Delice= Yummyz.
author: Manfred L.

description:
The food at Aux Delices cannot merely be eaten, it must be experienced.  When you place that first forkful of food into your mouth, suddenly you are transported away.  No longer are you sitting in a restaurant, but floating in the vast spaces of the universe.  The planets and stars swirl and dance around you.  The flavors rush into your mouth like waves on the beach.  They slowly rise from nothingness.  Closer and closer they roll like a deep thunder from a distant storm.  As they grow nearer, they begin stumbling and crashing upon one another, so anxious for the one brief and beautiful moment when they can feel themselves writhing upon the moist warmth of your pallette.  Finally, they crash themselves upon your tongue in a frothy orgy of pure culinary bliss.  As soon as it has begun, it is over.  They retreat into themselves, back into an ocean of flavor until you take that next bite.  Soon everything disappears, and it all turns to nothingness.  Only colors remain.  Vibrant hues of blue, green, yellow, red, and orange.  The faces of everyone you've loved and everyone you will love appear before you.  All you feel is the warmth that emanates from the comfort of being reconciled with the world and everything in it.  Some would call it the rapture.

Eating at this restaurant reminded me of that scene in the movie Hook, where after a long, hard day of training Robin Williams to be Peter Pan, the lost boys all sit down and have a huge feast.  Everybody's eating this gooey, paint looking type stuff, which apparently was delicious.  Ever since I saw that movie, i always wanted to taste that gooey stuff.  I imagined what this paint food might taste like.  Flavors both strangely exotic and new, yet oddly warm and familiar.  Flavors that simultaneously exploded in your mouth with zest and vigor, and also languished upon your pallette in their soft and understated subtlety.  Like a home-cooked meal from your grandma, except your grandma is a orphaned boy from some magical island who never ages.  This is my dream.  Aux Delices has helped me take one step closer to this dream.
author: Eddie L.

description:
I believe I have turned the majority of my friends on to this joint... guess I can try to turn y'all on as well.

I came here with an ex-boyfriend... and although that ex has been kicked to the curb, my love of Aux Delices remains true
I have to say that I find myself having all out cravings for caramel chicken from Aux Delice- one of my must have dishes every time I go. The shrimp and sugar cane appetizer is absolutely delicious. The noodle salads are also delightful, as are glass noodle seafood dish! 

And did I mention that I can still enjoy a meal here without sacrificing a large portion of my measly unemployment income?
author: Erin C.

description: Wow, pretty good! I had dinner here last night for the second time and I'm even more impressed. My recommendations: (1) CHA GIO - fried spring rolls; (2) BUN BO XAO - sauteed beef with lemongrass over rice noodles; (3) BO LUC LAC - filet mignon cubes served with caramelized onions over lettuce. Nice little neighborhood spot in Russian Hill, I like it!
author: Brian B.

description: Despite the 1970's-era restaurant sign, this place is actually quite modern and comfortable on the inside. Great wine selection for a neighborhood restaurant, and I'd highly recommend the claypot chicken. Overall, great place to go for a casual bite to eat on Polk Street.
author: Chris B.

description: I love this place, the food is amazing, the family that owns it is great. The food is prepared with TLC, and seems less oily and better for you than some other Vietnamese restaurants Ive been to. Prices are very reasonable, I wanna go there right now!
author: Chris P.

description: Nice environment.  Mediocre food.  We got the banh cuon (steamed dumplings) which were okay, the muc cari (curried squid) which was a little overcooked and subject to the very excessive use of bottled curry powder and the bo luc lac (filet mignon cubes sauteed in garlic over lettuce) which was interesting and pretty tasty, but I mean, its filet mignon so its already delicious by default and it still could have been better, although I am intrigued by hot lettuce dishes.  Reasonably priced, nice staff, although we ordered the large rice, they gave us the small and then tried to charge us for the large.  Not bad, but not a repeat for me.
author: Green T.

description: Delicious and in a cozy, cute neighborhood. Everything tasted incredibly fresh, flavorful, and plenty of options for vegheads. Icing on the cake was the Vietnamese coffee-- if you haven't tried this and are a coffee lover, you must try it out!
author: Christine T.

description:
okay okay I had my doubts I thought this was going to be another Betelnut or Dragonwell....but I was surprised.....it  was actually really really good. We tried the beef pho and the BBQ pork, imperial rolls, and fried rice...it was all super yummy...

note: if your roommate tries to convince you that two people can finish a whole carafe of wine......don't fall for it...cause  it's A LOT of wine....luckily we powered through...
author: Joy Y.

description: When I want to grab something to eat in the neighborhood, it ends up being kinda late.  This never pairs well with my indecision.  I walk up Polk looking at every menu and still I end up at Aux Delices, its about ten blocks from where I live. This place has some of my favorite flavors all put together.  Service is incredibly friendly and informative.  You don't have to learn the hard way not to swallow sugar cane whole. If you haven't been here yet, you are missing out!
author: Paul S.

description: Good Vietnamese food here.Place for family dinner or friend nite out.
author: christy l.

description: Some friends suggested this place.  The decor is nicer than most Vietnamese restaurants but the food certainly isn't.  It was a bad tradeoff - slightly better decor and service for lower quality, bland food.  And yes, it also costs more than your average Vietnamese.
author: Paul K.

description:
what in the hell is the big deal?  this is standard Vietnamese food.  come on folks.  there's nothing super exciting here.  the pho was pho, the catfish in a clay pot, more saucy than authentic, the dessert- standard, banana and ice cream, and my other guests had similar resignations over the ordinary-Vietnamese of it all.  AND WE'RE ALL VIETNAMESE.  three adults and two kids, in a booth, and not impressed!  

this is the minimum i would expect from a place with wine glasses, and a set table with linen napkins.  

the service was good.  hence the three stars.  and not two.  it's a good place for a date who isn't off-the-boat Vietnamese, the decor is comfortable, and warm.  but the food, the food is just OK.  honest.
author: Carolyn H.

description: Fantastic vietnamese food, friendly and attentive service, and nice ambience -- when was the last time I had white tablecloths and napkins at a reasonably-priced restaurant?!?! This place is a real find!
author: Daniel S.

description: In an attempt to relive our vacation to Vietnam we came to Aux Delices to try 2 dishes we loved in Hanoi:  the Cha Ca and the Bun. It's impossible to recreate the excessive sound of scooters honking, the sub-standard hygienic practices and overall charm of a proper Hanoi street restaurant.  But Aux Delices does a great job with American versions of these dishes and the service almost made us feel like we were there again.  I highly recommend both dishes washed down with a Tiger beer.
author: Kelli R.

description: I thought the restaurant was going to be bigger, but it appeared to be a good size. The decor was nice and table settings appeared fancy..I came here for my birthday with a group of my close friends and I was kind of disappointed with the service. When we arrived, no one greeted us and we were told to wait until my whole party arrived. Half of us were already there. I guess I was disappointed because another party arrived with 3 people out of a group of 9 and the staff sat them down right away. :(  We had to wait about 45 minutes before being seated. We wanted to order a glass of wine, but we were told that we couldn't order until we were at our table. I asked if we can order at the bar and they looked pretty confused. I was a bit bummed out but was still patient since I didn't want this to ruin my birthday. I ended ordering the vermicelli bowl with the grilled pork and I have to say, the grilled pork was tender and perfectly marinated, but the sauce that came with it, could've been better. It was a bit on the sweeter side, but not too bad. I've had better. My friends seemed to enjoy their dishes as well, but I'm only giving them 3 stars because the service could be better. Minus 1 star for the service and minus 1 star for them telling me I couldn't order a drink on my birthday until we were seated! lol..Overall, I will have to try it one more time.
author: Vee C.

description: $38 total for a bottle of sake, a giant beer, spring rolls and delicious veggie curry with brown rice?  Enough said.
author: Leslie R.

description: I went for the first time last week.  We had vegetable curry and lemongrass tofu, and it was all seriously good and affordable.  Really nice atmosphere, too.
author: Heather H.

description: This was a really pleasant surprise and we got a great seat by the window.  I ordered the BBQ pork with fried rice and imperial rolls. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because I've had BBQ pork in San Diego that was really really good (like thick cuts of pork, very juicy and flavorful) and here they were thin slices and a little drier but still flavorful.  The fried rice was very light and not greasy at all and the rolls were delicious! Bf ordered the BBQ beef and shrimp skewers, it was VERY good and I highly recommend the beef over the pork.  It was really juicy and flavorful.  The price is very inexpensive for the quality of food you get and the decor was very nice.  I would definitely go back!
author: Emiko M.

description: Had one of the most unique meals here.  We had the shrimp on sugar cane appetizer - highly recommend!  I like food that you put together at the table, and this was no exception!  Really, really tasty and different from what I'e had/seen at other Vietnamese restaurants.
author: maisnon ..

description:
where do I begin??  Great food, even better service

huge portions for the price! 

Booths are great for dates... This is my place of choice for special occasions!

Imperial Rolls--- best in the city!
Great wine selection also!
author: c e.

description: I'm vietnamese.  I like the vietnamese food here.  A bit on the pricey side but nice ambiance.  Will come back.
author: Jane N.

description: I live right around the corner from Aux Delices, and have taken numerous out of town guests (parents, German cousin, etc.) here for the cheap and delicious Vietnamese food. I wouldn't necessarily travel from far away lands to eat here (i.e. the Richmond or Bernal Heights), but if you live in the hood, it's always a good fallback. Plus, the staff is really sweet and the surroundings calm.
author: Ava S.

description: As an advocate for cheap-but-good eats, this place is a little pricey for authentic Vietnamese cuisine.  But to make up for that, they have the clean, decorated ambiance that most Vietnamese restaurants lack.  Very 'user- friendly' for the person that's just starting to venture into Vietnamese food.  I would come here for the ambiance rather than the food, and that being said, I would not come here again.  That's not to say my experience here wasn't satisfactory, because I did enjoy my food here.  But with my repertoire of Vietnamese restaurants to choose from, I probably wouldn't choose this one.
author: Lovina C.

description: So tasty.  Good prices, creative food, and to top it off - great wines by the glass.
author: Amy D.

description:
this place is awesome! only problem is finding parking can be kind of a pain, but it's definitely worth it.  i went with some friends (one is a vegetarian) and was blown away at just how great the food was.  every dish we had was good.  

whether you like to eat meat..or if you don't everything was great. plus service was pleasant, we had great conversation and they refilled our drinks without interrupting or even us noticing :)

highly recommended!
author: Elaine G.

description: I used to love love looooove Aux Delices.  There aren't a ton of pho places in Russian Hill, and I would say at least once a month I'm either ordering delivery, take-out, or going all out and dining in the restaurant.  Although last night my experience pretty much turned me off to the place all together.  My boyfriend and I just wanted some pho, so we stopped in to grab a cup ($5) of beef pho for him, and a bowl ($8) of chicken pho for me -- yes, I eat more than my boyfriend.  The waitress looked at us and said, "no, I'm sorry but you'll have to order more".  My boyfriend looked at her in confusion and when asked why, the server replied "it's a $10 minimum for all food".  My boyfriend pointed out that our meal combined came to $13, and I'm no mathemagician but I'm pretty sure $13 is more than $10.  Regardless, she said "no, you have to order a medium".  We were pho hungry at this point and didn't feel like walking over to Sweet Aromas, so we said screw it and ordered the medium.  Now don't get me wrong -- I completely understand the need for a restaurant to have a minimum.  But I have never been in a restaurant that refused to serve me CHEAP items that are clearly listed on the front of their menu, and I hope they take the $17 that we ended up spending last night and buy a nice calculator.  But for now, they can simply subtract me as a customer.
author: Courtney K.

description: This place rocks out the food!!!!# 43 Lemon grass Beef is screamin!!!!!!
author: Jeff T.

description: Delicious! And my favorite delivery. Try the claypot chicken and crispy chicken. Bun is better at other vietnamese places, but everything else is completely wonderful.
author: Noelle Q.

description: Classy vietnamese place without the hefty menu prices.   We ordered the steamed dumplings, salmon claypot, beef with tofu, and stuffed chicken and everything was SO good.  This vietnamese place was not all about pho and spring rolls, there was a very diverse menu selection and unique dishes that I have not seen anywhere else.  I am a fan.
author: Debbie Y.

description: yummy casual dinner out.  A bit expensive for the fare, though.  Service wasn't so great.
author: Monika M.

description: Amazing food. A healthier alternative to Chinese or Thai, and soooooo yummy. Their beef skewers are to die for and their banana flambe dessert is heavenly. Drink lots of sake and relax.
author: Shyla B.

description:
every time i eat here i think it's good. i have only not reviewed it out of sheer laziness. and this is going to be a pretty lazy review too. 

just get their noodle salad. the bbq'd pork and spring rolls version is a hit and will fill you up real nice. but then, you could pour fish sauce on anything and i'd think it was good.

it's low key, with a nice, quiet ambiance. the servers are soft-spoken and sweet. i'd say it's good for a date or catching up with a friend. and it won't break the bank at all.
author: rachel p.

description:
Great place for the nice, casual Vietnamese dinner. Although we walked in without reservations, we were seated within ten minutes. For starters, I was extremely happy to see lychee sakitinis on the menu. So naturally we ordered two to start the evening. They were delicious. Sweet and refreshing!

We started with the lemon grass soup with shrimp. It was really good. Flavorful broth filled with mushrooms, bean sprouts, shrimp, sweet pineapple and lemon grass and cilantro. Next, we got the shrimp and sugar cane rolls. They sounded really unique and interesting, so I was very excited about this dish. When the waiter brought it out, I had a very "shocked" look on my face. They came unprepared! You were suppose to roll your own rolls! Although I love to make spring rolls, I was not really in the mood to roll up my sleeves and to start rolling. Of course, we did and it wasn't half bad. My only compliant was the rice wrappers were WAY too small for all the ingredients. (noodles, lettuce, shrimp and sugarcane, and cucumber) So it was a bit tough. Also, it wasn't fresh shrimp... it was mashed up shrimp meat.. sorta like patties. Overall, they were good, but I wished we were warned prior to ordering.

For our main courses, we shared the snapper fillets with basil, mushrooms, and ginger. VERY tasty. The other dish was fresh tofu with veggies. It was a good dish, but not that special. Along with a side of brown rice, our tummies were very happy. 

The good news, for all this, our bill came out to be only $55! What a deal. I would definitely recommend coming here for an authentic Vietnamese dinner.
author: Denise L.

description: Great food, great location, good service, comfortable ambiance and reasonable prices...is there anything else to be said?  Two thumbs up.  Try the beef pho and the green papaya salad for healthy and light options.
author: Nilu r.

description: My fiance was reluctant to come here because of several mediocre meals he had here back in the day.  Turns out it was like 10 years ago, so after reading all the good reviews here, we decided it was time to check it out.  We are both so glad that we did.  It was absolutely delicious.  We had the veggie spring rolls (non-fried), claypot chicken (him), lemongrass tofu (me), and fried banana with coconut ice cream.    Every dish was superb.  If I could, I would also give them 10 bonus stars for having a sign posted saying "no cellphone use in the restaurant".   Of course this jackass was standing in front of it yapping it up on his phone.  As my brother would say - it's not that he can't read, it's that he doesn't bother to.  Anyways, I have a feeling we are going to become regulars here at Aux Delices.
author: Squirrel L.

description: Wonderful!  The flavors are full, fresh and fabulous.  The green papaya salad with shrimp is a must-have.  The meat is flavorful and high quality, and vegtables are super fresh. I highly recommend this place.  I agree with "krankee c "- even better than Yummy Yummy.
author: B R.

description: The atmosphere at this place is a bit confused -- it doesn't seem sure if it wants to be high-end, or your typical Vietnamese restaurant, or what.  The thit nuong was very good; the beef with lemongrass and ginger was very average.  My service experience was polite but very spotty.  It's convenient to me, though, and the food was decent, so I'll give it another try.
author: Ficus K.

description: This place is decent I guess buuuuuuut dude, you could do soooooo much better. There are so many better places on Clement street. Nevertheless when I don't feel like driving to Clement or getting mugged walking through the Tenderloin I go here for some relatively affordable, servicable Vietnamese food.
author: Cathy T.

description: A nice spot for a casual date. The prices are good for those of us watching our wallet and the food was well above average. The wine list is short but more than adequate and we experienced a great viongnier for under 7 bucks a glass! It paired beautifully with the fried sweet and sour garlic chicken. Our server was a delight and made the whole evening a pleasant experience. Not once did we feel rushed or pressured to order more. Highly recommended restaurant in a cute little neighborhood!
author: Stacy T.

description: We ordered the spring rolls, caramel salmon, and spicy green papaya salad. I wasn't a fan of the spring rolls but the rest was really good. We also ordered the 04 Pinot Noir off the menu and it was decent. The restaurant's decor is really strange. Service was quick and there was no wait. If you are looking for Vietnamese around this area I definitely recommend checking Aux Delices out.
author: Deepak J.

description: This is on our weekly rotation for food delivery.  It's THAT yummy.  Imperial rolls should be eaten everyday.  Everything here is so flavorful.  I actually find the food here to be more impressive than Slanted Door.  yo!
author: Lisa C.

description: This is my new favorite spot for delivery on those days when you don't feel like going to whole foods, want something healthier than pizza, but not sushi... I haven't been to the actual restaurant but am so happy I can have shrimp and pork fresh spring rolls (among other things) delivered to my door (as long as you order at least $20 worth of food and live close by). Oh yummy!
author: Kathy L.

description: At this point, I think I go/get take out at least once every three weeks.  Alongside everything else, the vietnamese crepe as a starter is a must!
author: Lisa D.

description: I'm on the same page as Rebecca H.: too lazy and tired to cook after a long day at work. Luckily Aux Delices delivers! Their delivery is prompt and the pho (with tofu or beef) is good.
author: Dee I.

description:
A few years ago, a group of friends and I went to Pasha but had a horrible experience so we walked around and found Aux Delices. We were a group of 12 but they were able to seat us super quickly. Since then we've been going back to the restaurant and have always enjoyed it. It's a place we bring friends and they love it too. 

The service is good, the food is quick and always tasty. I also don't find the portions to be small at all. They also remember our special requests - like my boyfriend never wants bean sprouts in his dishes which they remember. Not only that but we find the price point to be really great. It's a little more expensive than say Mai's on Clement but it has a nice ambiance, clean bathrooms and is still a great value.
author: Kat G.

description: The curry is light with a nice hint of lemongrass not heavy coconut..if it were not for the dirty dishes n windows I would have given it four stars..price reasonable
author: holly c.

description:
Love this place... great food and great service. Have been eating here for over a year atleast twice a week as I have not found another place around that matches it. 

Yes, the get busy, especially on the weekends, but Chris and Tina always make sure that you are well taken care of. 

They are also good for larger groups and have hosted 20 of my friends without any problems and the food has been just as excellent. 

Try the Caramel Custard its unbelievable!
author: Arvind T.

description: We order to-go nearly every single week and occasionally dine at this beautiful restaurant.  They really have a distinctive touch and we enjoy bringing out of town guests here for the food in particular, but the always-excellent service and very reasonable prices don't hurt either.  Our cast of "regular" dishes are always perfectly prepared, and the kitchen does especially well with custom orders.  I can't recommend Aux Delices highly enough.
author: Larry B.

description: Aux Delice is one of my favorite places on Polk Street.  I go there for lunch regularly and they have a tasty beef noodle salad.  The place is family run and the service always quick and cheerful.
author: Annabel G.

description: The food is good, the atmosphere is clean, and you never have to wait for a table.  Its pretty authentic, and you have to pay $8 for Pho, but, what do you expect - this is Russian Hill...
author: Andrew C.

description: Mmm, one of my favorite Vietnamese places in San Francisco. A friend from Australia came to visit and he tried the more exotic dishes like the squid dish and really liked it. I usually stick to my usual grilled pork or chicken with steamed rice. Good presentation, decent portions, and moderately priced.
author: Xelyn x.

description:
sooooo good...and super reasonable
we ordered a carafe of wine for like $15
then had the crab and lettuce rolls, 
then had the veggie crepe
and the glass noodles with shrimp and crab

everything was delicious, the presentation was very nice, and the service fast and efficient.

can't wait to go back!
author: Lauren V.

description: Went here for dinner with a bunch of coworkers and the boss. We all knew the boss would pick up the tab, so we went to town on ordering tons of food. Call me ignorant, but before Aux Delices was even suggested, I had no idea there was such thing as French-Vietnamese! The food is amazingly delicious. And, literally, finger-licking delicious, because some of the food is a bit messy with all the mouth-watering sauces they cover their food with. I can't wait to go back.
author: Michael R.

description: The spring rolls that we had were pretty tasty (albeit standard), but the pho was unimpressively bland. I didn't think it was worth the price that this neighborhood seems to necessitate.
author: Shannon R.

description: Yum.  The fact that you can eat a late lunch, like until 3ish during the week is great.  The crab glass noddles are what really stick out in my mind.  Don't be alarmed if no one is there late, it is all good.  Also the soups are very filling.
author: Nicole F.

description: A low-key kind of restaurant with a nice array of menu items. No pho on this menu but you can still get bun and some other really delicious stir-fry's and curries and things. The service was attentive but not overbearing and the food came relatively quickly. That being said, there are places where you can easily get this caliber of food without paying friggin $9 for one bun.
author: Madeline N.

description: Kind of like Le Cheval in Oakland but not as good.  If I wasn't Vietnamese/French I'd give it a 4 star, but since I am, it's average at best.
author: Tinou B.

description: I really like this place!  It is in my old neighborhood and it is a great place to get take out and go for a nice, yet casual dinner.  They know me and my aunt there, and I always ordered the bun chay noodle salad.  Put some chili sauce on it and you're ready to go.  Tasty food, reasonable prices, and a quiet atmosphere.
author: Tamara M.

description: Parking on Valentine's Day was a nightmare, and I certainly wouldn't have ventured into this part of town if it weren't for my friend's gentle urging, but once I sat down and started eating, I was glad to have made the right decision. The papaya salad I had was good and refreshing, and the little kick it had was a welcome surprise. I also enjoyed the special desserts they served on V-day. The chocolate begniets (spelling??) and vanilla-bean gelato were a perfect pairing. And the meringue I had was delightful too, as fitting the name and theme of this gem of a restaurant.
author: Philip W.

description: we walked 10 miles to get to this restaurant (and back) and it was a great exercise to prep your stomach for a feast.  the one must item is their crab.  this is not your typical steam crab with butter but it's the whole dungeoness crab pan fried in spicy onion, garlic.  mix it with garlic noodles and rice ... WOW!
author: Samuel C.

description: I love this place!  I've never had a bad meal in the restaurant or for take-out.  The sweet crispy garlic chicken is awesome as well as the chicken claypot!  Mmmmm....making myself hungry.
author: Cameron M.

description: I wouldn't drive to go here, however If you're close to this place, its a great take out or eat in spot.  The food is good and the portions are ample.  An inexpensive dinner that has good flavor...
author: Jason M.

description: I returned to Aux Delices tonight after several months away, and I must admit I was quite pleased!  The services seems to be much friendlier than before and the food is still really good.  We had the green papaya salad, they have turned down the heat a bit which allows more flavors to stand out...yum!  The fried imperial rolls are a go-to favorite and they definitely didn't disappoint (our waiter didn't even cop an attitude when I asked or more mint).  We had the beef curry this time, and although I probably wouldn't order it again because there are dishes I like better, it really was quite tasty.  Overall, I was impressed with the food and service, and pleasantly surprised to have "rediscovered" this neighborhood gem.
author: caitlin c.

description: I think this place is really special.  I had never tried this fusion of Vietnamese and French before and I loved every bite.  They seat you right away and the service is great.
author: Joanna S.

description:
Tasty lemongrass chicken bun. No need to risk life and limb in the hood to get fresh, flavorful Viet eats in the City!

*** After my last visit I decided to revise my review. My boyfriend asked if they can grill our chicken (like at authentic Vietnamese restaurants) and they said yes, but at an extra charge. Since they grill other meats, I don't understand why there will be an extra charge for the chicken (we ordered the lemongrass chicken bun so it was an extra charge on top of that). Regardless, $11 for so-so chicken bun is unacceptable.
author: Mama L.

description: My first Vietnamese experience, I love it! The spring rolls, the coconut curry beef! Yum. All very light and fresh. The service was a little slow, but I can deal with that for a casual night out.
author: Lisa K.

description: The food wasn't bad but I wouldn't go back either.  Sort of like PF Chang's, their sauces are heavily sugared.  The pork wasn't tender, the shrimp was tasty, barbecue beef was good, the rolls were good.  I think it'd be a 3 1/2 stars, but the service, while efficient, was not friendly.
author: Kevin Y.

description: This place is always amazing! I have yet to have a bad dish here. Currently I love the beef satay and the pho is also an excellent stand by. The chicken in caramel sauce is to die for. Also the imperial roll app is scrumptious. Prices are super cheap too. Don't forget their carafe's of wine The cabernet is great and at $16, why not?
author: elissa w.

description: First of all, I'm not an expert in Vietnamese food, therefore my review of this place has to be taken with the grain of salt. Having said this, I've really liked the place, specially because of the food. The restaurant is ok, it's kind of in between a very authentic place and a more design decor, the thing is that is none of the too at the end. But the food was good but I not sophisticated enough to justify the extra price. The same place with better prices would have been great. The same place with a more authentic food would have been great. The same place with a better decor would have been great. Do you get the sensation that aux Delices is little bit good at everything but not great in anything in particualr. Me too:)
author: Alex A.

description: It's really hard to find good vegetarian Vietnamese food, but this place gets it right. They have interesting meat substitute options, and it's nice and warm and glowy inside, unlike some more Tenderloiny places. Their fried bananas were a little heavy on the fried part, but I've been here twice and everything else was superb. Be aware, the wait staff is a little sluggish, so you may have to wave someone over eventually.
author: Nick A.

description: The one star is not for the very good food but because we were told there would be no problem making certain dishes without onions as my friend is allergic. They did not leave them out in any dish and as a result she was very sick. This is serious.
author: Howard L.

description: Im obsessed with the #3, Mien Ga. It rocks my world. $7 and guaranteed to help you during cold season. I just had my bf eat here fro the first time and he is also now a committed fan. YUM.
author: Lady L.

description: Unfortunately the secret is out with the B&T lot, because there was a party of about 10, mostly teenagers, with their parents from Folsom having dinner the night we went.  Aside from that, this place is a great little gem with a great diverse menu that is much better than 'traditional' vietnamese places with 1000s of Pho dishes on the menu.  The catfish in a clay pot with caramel sauce was A+.
author: George K.

description: Great little gem on Polk street that makes great Pho, along with traditional Vietnames dishes.  Great lunch spot and awesome value.  The staff is very polite and helpful also!
author: Steven S.

description: Good but not great. I'll probably order something else next time. I got #25 which was pork with rice and some sort of fried roll. Based on the other reviews here, I'll come back and simply get something else. Maybe I should ask the server what she recommends.
author: Stu M.

description:
eating here is easier than pronouncing the name, which'll make you  hawk a loogie if said too fast.    my gf and i are regulars here, and love the crispy chickin tenders - reminds us of san tung chicken wings, sans bones.   brought the 'rents and brother for a post-thxgiving dinner, and they hearted it very much, despite their temperamental palettles (mom and pops are moonlighting chefs).   try the chicken, garlic noodles, sampler platter, and even the pho is purty good.

great food, good prices, never have to wait long for a table.  parking kinda sucks, but if the parking gods are with you, something usually opens up on polk.
author: Ray K.

description: First time ever at aux Delices & it was phenomenal!  I had heard it was great for a long time, but just never ventured over - and tonight was no different. I'd planned for a 'go-to' but it was closed for the New Year.  We walked to find what's open & I suggested 2 other places before deciding on Vietnamese.  And I can't begin to tell you how glad I was that we did. I don't think the restaurant was prepared for the holiday rush, but they handled it really well.  (plus, we beat it just in time ).  Had the Chicken Noodle Pho Soup, Imperial Rolls, Claypot Chicken & Shaken Filet Mignon.  All out of this world.  Definitely Go. Go. & Go again.
author: Natalie P.

description: One of my favorite places to eat.  Their lunch menu is a great value, and dinner is wonderful too though more expensive.  Highlights include the shrimp on sugar cane dish and many of the lunch salads.  The owner/chef is also very friendly.
author: Curt L.

description: Aux Delices is a great option for Vietnamese food.  The Pho is excellent (if you order take out Pho make sure to have a large bowl ready since it is served as individual ingredients that need to be put together in order to be served).  I have eaten here countless times (mostly take out) and have always been satisfied.
author: Trevor T.

description:
I looove this place.  Its like a hidden gem on Polk St. and they serve Pho!!!!  I only tried this place because its the only Pho close to my house and I was very impressed.  

I have since been back their serveral times and I really enjoyed the spicy chicken dish I had as well.
author: Richard C.

description: Awesome authentic Vietnamese food.great vegetarian spring rolls and rice noodles. Great service as well
author: Sameer N.

description: i like my vietnamese restaurants with no frills, like the local pho shops.  so i have a hard time loving any vietnamese restaurant that tries to gourmet it up.  to me, pho is never worth $9.  dishes i've tried here have been pretty good and if i didn't have a bias coming in, my ranking would probably be higher.
author: Helen T.

description: On Valentine's day after an hour at the pillow fight we were starving and needed good food. Aux Delices came through again in a big way. This is our third time at the restaurant. Each time the food was fresh and expertly prepared. The service is very good and the prices are reasonable too. We had reservations for Valentine's but the other two times we were walk-ins and got seated promptly. Oh yeah, the restaurant is really cozy and cute. It's in a great neighborhood too. This one is a winner.
author: Top Cat S.

description: The Pho was amazing! I am picky about pho meat and the beef was tender and thinly-sliced to perfection. Paired with a cucumber salad app and an affordable bottle of wine, it was a great dining experience. Can't wait to go back!
author: Lisa C.

description:
Sorry. I feel weird for giving a bad review when there are many 4's and 5's, but this place is not what you could expect from a Vietnamese restaurant.
Party of 6, we all got different plates, but they all tasted the same. The sauce tasted more Chinese than south-east Asian. The calamari and other fish was not good. The least disappointing plate was a beef clay pot.
Anyways, I guess that's all I can say. Again, after a bad experience, we had to go get our mouths washed with a good taco Al Pastor at El Tonayense :-)
author: Peppe R.

description: I had high expectation for this place, but it turned out very disappointing, it took almost 23 minutes to get my Egg rolls, the orange duck was dry and overcooked. Servers were not attentive at all.  And if you are going to charge $2.50 for a pot of hot tea, shouldn't the water be boiling HOT.
author: L K.

description: Great food, great service, and cheap wine.  My favorites here are the chicken porridge, clay pot catfish, imperial rolls, and anything with glass noodles (but especially the seafood).  It's cheap for Russian Hill but a little pricey for a Vietnamese restaurant - totally worth it, though.
author: Heather C.

description:
Let me tell you about my new secret love affair with pho, and how it led me to rediscover this sweet, family-run little gem.  PHA! PHA! PHA! - Sorry, I'm a bit of a cheerleader for it). I've recently come to the corny realization that sometimes the best things are just around the corner...

So who cares that I on the verge of needing to join Pho Anonymous.

Truth be told pho is a comfort food related to my Jewish chicken noodle soup.  Really not that far off.  Cept the Sriricha sauce and all the basil and stuff.  Oh. My. God. Yum.  So back to Aux Delices.  I had always come here for their Chao Tom, the roasted shrimp wrapped in sugar cane with make-it-yourelf rice rolls (anyone who shies away because of having to make their own roll ... well, I'm feeling too dainty to comment further at the moment).  That is really really tight, almost or just as good as Pagolac.  Then after my acupuncturist kept reiterating that I should eat more "warm, cooked foods," when my lazy butt doesn't want to cook I come here for light, tasty basil chicken.  Then I went back to Pho and my hubby and I started trekking down to LIttle Saigon every weekend.  Yes, Turtle Tower rocks, but besides that, I wasn't soo into any other pho.  I kept thinking, Aux Delices is better, and it's local, and plus its run by that sweet family... So now I come here ALOT.  And I'm always satisifed.  

They've got a great M-F lunch special too.  My husband loves the Ga Chien, sticky sweet garlicly chicken kind of like Sesame Chicken only awesomer.  

Thank you, Aux Delices.  Loves ya.
author: Ashley S.

description: Ordered the garlic noodles, some kind of fried chicken in a sweet sauce, and the shrimp salad. OMG! Everything was made to perfection! We were not very hungry, but everything tasted so good that we finished everything we ordered anyway. I will be back here for sure!
author: A L.

description: Wow, this place is amazing! There's not much to say except go there and enjoy! I even got takeout from them and it was delievered fast and very hot. I'm addicted!
author: Elyse R.

description: After a 2 1/2 year hiatus from San Francisco this was my first real Vietnamese in a long time.  New York just pales in comparison.  So during vacation this week this was my choice for great Vietnamese while in town and thanks for fellow yelpers I tried it and it was FANTASTIC!  From the vietnamese dumplings to the CHA CA and the MUC CARI ending with the Fried bananas and vanilla ice cream I was in heaven.  Couldn't be happier - the service was friendly and the price was very reasonable.  Wish I could bring it back to NY with me....
author: Pamela Y.

description: Wow was this good. Much better than Slanted Door. The caramelized pork/shrimp dish was mind blowing. Their shaking beef was insanely tender and flavorful. Soups were really fresh and well seasoned. This has been a longterm mainstay for a reason. Maybe best semi upscale Vietnamest in the city.
author: Christopher C.

description: I went with the overall opinion with this place and I tried it last night expecting some good food, but was disappointed. I didn't, however, try their papaya salad, usually my favorite dish, so that might be good. But my imperial rolls and pork and fried rice were pretty gross - flavorless and way TOO oily. Yuck. I did appreciate the big pieces of egg in the fried rice, but, again, I couldn't believe the oil and regretted eating it the whole next day. I don't recommend.
author: Allison W.

description: This place is cool if you like to jump into a different culture for dinner.  If you haven't been before, I bet you will try something new there.  I have had one better dish of this cuisine in the city, but this place is simple, unpretencious, and affordable.
author: Sam B.

description: This is my absolute fav vietnamese restaurant in the bay area- it's super tasty and best of all... it's authentic! At least in my opinion it is. Most vietnamese restaurants are either extremely dirty or way too upscale & westernized (ie. Ana Mandara, Tamarine... etc). The prices are fair and the place is clean! FIVE STARS. I'll make a half-day trip up to SF with my bf just to eat this place for dinner.... I'll be back soon hopefully :]
author: Steph M.

description: I think the food here is great.  My friends all talked about it and I finally went.. Loved it.  I got the seafood combo dish and we shared the make ur own roll app!  So good!  Go and try it!
author: Jacki H.

description:
Probably one of the best parts of my experience dining at Aux Delices, was the pace at which my dinner progressed. The hostess, servers, and waiters were all very attentive and prompt, yet none of them were pushy or rushed. My normal pace of eating is somewhere close to that of a hoover vacuum. It is placed in front of me, and within three minutes, my plate is cleared and I'm ready for the check. 

At Aux Delices however, they do not serve the next portion of the meal until the dish that they had previously set down was cleared. Yet on top of this, we were not forgotten by the wait staff, who made their continuous rounds filling our cups and making sure we were enjoying ourselves. This made for a relaxing dinner that was truly enjoyed.

I highly recommend both the Salt and Pepper shrimp, as well as the pork/shrimp dumplings. Phenomenal with their chili sauce.
author: Kelli T.

description: Great neighborhood place! I always get the Chao Ga (chicken and rice porridge). The fried imperial rolls are amazing! What a bargain too.
author: Gino D.

description: I've eaten here several times and am never disappointed.  The atmosphere is lovely and relaxed.  The food is fresh, delicious, reasonably priced and elegantly served.  There is an excellent wine list (foreign and domestic).  Last night was the hottest night of the year in San Francisco (8/25/2010)  and it was sweltering hot.  Stepping into Aux Delices, we were thrilled to discover they had really great, powerful air conditioning -- it made for an marvelous evening at the restaurant.  The family that runs this place is charming and sophisticated -- They really know how to offer an exceptional experience to local diners!
author: Channing T.

description: Best Pho in the neighborhood- mmmmm delicious!  Calamari curry, crispy chicken & basil chicken are also great.  Not much atmosphere for dining in, but delivery is super fast.
author: Maggie Z.

description: Friendly staff, excellent food. Great place with choice of vegetarian food. The staff is not overbearing and they let you have long dinners without pestering you to turn over the table.
author: Anupam S.

description: I went for the pho because of the great reviews.  The meat was mediocre.  I couldn't eat it.  The broth wasn't very flavorful and was just disappointing in general.  The thai iced teas we ordered weren't very sweet.  The service...eh.  Nothing to run home and tell Mom about.  I think next time I'll go out of my way and head to Chinatown/FiDi and go to Golden Star Veitnamese Restaurant.  Cheap and tasty!
author: Whitney A.

description: OMG this place has such amazing food and service--but food seriously. I was just in SF visiting and I wish I could go back. I ordered the Crepes that came with pork and shrimp-to die for. Then I ordered for an entree the Kalbi/Korean ribs and I'm telling you I was in heaven. Topped it off with some plum wine. Yummmy!
author: Gee K.

description: I came to Aux Delices thinking it was going to be french/ vietnamese.  I've had great french vietnamese food at Bui in Berkeley. However, Aux Delices seems just to be another vietnamese place. Located in Russian Hill, this small restaurant has slightly kitchy decor. The staff was very friendly and once seated we immediately got tea (very small cups of it). We started with the spring rolls, rice paper filled with lettuce, chicken, cilantro, carrots, and shrimp with a peanut dipping sauce. They were okay, I thought the chicken tasted a little weird, I also would have liked to have basil in the rolls. The peanut sauce was fine, I added some chili sauce to add spice. Next we had a ginger beef noodle soup. The broth was delicious and aromatic, and the beef tasted buttery. The egg noodles were a chewy addition. Mushrooms and veggies were plentiful. Our last dish was fried chicken in a sweet garlic sauce. I was thinking this was going to be similar to some spicy chicken wings I've had before with fried basil. This was completely different, but the chicken was still good. Overall, I liked the food, but since I was expecting more french influence, I'm not sure it lived up to that. I personally would go to Bui for the french/ vietnamese experience.
author: Kate A.

description: Yummy!  Try the calamari- different and delicious.  Reasonably priced and different menu :)
author: Jojo R.

description: It helps that Aux Delices is extremely well located.  It also helps that the food is awesome.  Try the lemon grass beef and anything else they've got.  This place doesn't disappoint.
author: Ken M.

description: Just got take out here for he first time last night, and I was really impressed.  The spring rolls were probably the best I've ever had.  We got the vegetarian ones, and I'm a totaly meat-eater, I didn't miss the meat a bit.  We also got the shrimp and cucumber salad, which was also really tasty.  For our entrees we got the vegetarian curry and the basil chicken.  Both were very good, but honestly the curry was my favorite.  Very delicate and balanced flavors.  Prices may be a tad high, but not unreasonable.  Two apps and two entrees came to $40 total.  I will definitely be back.
author: Ethan K.

description: My favorite item on the menu (garlic noodles) was greasy and lackluster and overall nothing was as good as I remembered it being.  I was willing to blame it on an off-day for the kitchen since, it was New Year's Day, maybe regular chef was out or hungover.  However 90% into the lunch, a medium sized cockroach appeared on the wall.  I'm not particularly squeamish but there are many other restaurants around so why settle?  Will not be returning.
author: amy y.

description: amazing fried rice!! the noodle salad was good, but it's hard to screw up. next time i will order something more adventurous. or maybe just the pho. fast delivery ($20 minimum).
author: Jessica W.

description:
i came here for dinner with my bf at the time for a "make-up" dinner. the food was okay. it wasn't vietnamese enough for my taste but we had to go there because my bf at the time didn't like any food out of the ordinary (yes, boring)... 

you can find much better places down in the tenderloin for vietnamese.
author: Miss O.

description: I go here for the Pho probably once a week. It's awesome.  Very clean establishment...I'm very picky about the source of my Pho since the beef is raw. This place is great!  Highly recommend it. I've had other items too and all are good.
author: Becca F.

description:
loved it!

not often I give a place 5 stars, but it's worth it here.  Three of us arrived for Sat night dinner and had a short wait, they were able to serve us Sake as we waited, made the short wait pleasant :)

The Chicken Clay Pot meal was perhaps the tastiest dish I have had in many years. The sauce is delightful, caramel.

The Summer Rolls were very tasty, and large in size, which was a nice treat.

The Pho was average, but perhaps because I am use to Pho 75 here in DC. 

I'm definitely going back!
author: James H.

description: aux delice is a nice place to go for vietnamese food when you don't want to go to your typical pho restaurant and don't want to spend the $ to go to slanted door.  you can really taste the quality ingredients they use here...everything is very light and refreshing.  i've had the bun here which is pretty typical.  instead, you should try some of the other dishes.  i had the stuffed chicken which was really good.  even better was the grilled white fish over fresh dill and green onions.
author: Helen T.

description: maybe i am spoiled with the amazing vietnamese food in seattle.. but i was hella craving vietnamese food and i thought to go online to find out a great place that was reputable.. but this overly americanized vietnamese food was more for the show than the quality of food.. and if the prices are going to be that good.... it better melt in my mouth..
author: Nina M.

description: great french vietnamese restaurant with decent prices, especially for the area. the shrimp spring rolls with sugar cane are so so yum.
author: Cathy C.

description: Good food, good atmosphere.  The food in Little Saigon is more authentic and cheaper, but at least to get here you don't have to get hit on by crackheads and push your way through thickets of hookers.
author: jessica d.

description: i've always had a fondness for this place.  i love the neigbhorhood (i live there now, but i've been a fan for a while), there's rarely a wait, and the prices are reasonable.  i always get the mixed veggies with fried tofu and the glass noodle dish with crab.  those are winners.  but when i've ventured away from my standards, i've been disappointed.  there are so many amazing cheap vietnamese joints in the city (bodega bistro, for instance), that i can't give this place more than 3.5 stars.  still, it's a solid choice and i'm glad to have it in the hood.
author: nicole l.

description: I've been here once and always wonder why I never came back. It's one of those places I came loved and forgot about. The food here was great the staff was friendly. I remember having really good noodles here but I don't remember that much.
author: Erica K.

description: After a really long and miserable day at work my fiance decided to surprise me with a dinner of my favorite comfort food, Pho.  We had just moved into the city and were still feeling our way around, so it was by pure luck that he stumbled onto Aux Delices on the net.  We were so impressed with our Pho and Chicken Chow Mien that we decided to go back and check it out.  Now it's a requirement, anytime a friend or family member comes into the city and wants to grab a quick and affordable bite to eat, we go here.  Whenever we're too lazy to cook, we go here.  When our kitchen sink was busted and we kept getting stood up by the plumber...you guessed it, we went here.  In fact, we eat here so often that the last time we went in and decided to stray from our usual, the waitress looked at us and said "What, no claypot tonight guys?"  OYE...if you are what you eat then I am pork and claypot chicken, fresh spring rolls, glass noodle soup, sweet and crispy garlic chicken and lemongrass tofu.  In fact, we've had half the menu so far and the only thing we weren't wow'd by was the beef and mushroom, not to say it wasn't good, just not up to the high standards we've come to expect.  We're addicted!
author: Chrys W.

description: My favorite Vietnamese restaurant in San Francisco.  Much cheaper than Slanted Door.  Excellent Vietnamese food!  Service is excellent too.
author: Reviewer Z.

description: consistently good quality, deliciouse spring rolls and noodles. highly recommend trying their dessert. overall, wonderful food and relaxing atmosphere.
author: alisa o.

description: Considering the lack of vietnamese restaurants in the area, it's ok if you're craving vietnamese and don't want to drive all the way down to san jose or even clement street.
author: LT B.

description: Tried this place with my girlfriend last week and we loved it so much that we went back for a second round last night. Try #43 it is fantastic!
author: Eric R.

description: Hands down best Vietnamese food in the area!  We've been going here for years getting food to go (typically the beef noodle pho) and bringing friends and family in.  I can honestly say, we've never had a bad meal or experience here... just typing this makes me want some pho with a side of spring rolls!
author: Amber T.

description: A little disappointed with this place. For some reason, I was expecting something a little more distinctive. The food's certainly "ok" but just as certainly it's nothing special.
author: Colin M.

description: Aux Delices is a great little Vietnamese place. We've gone there pretty steadily over the last year and I always order the same thing, beef skewers with lemongrass and rice. It's so flavorful. Boyfriend loves everything else on the menu and always wants to order in from here.
author: Rebecca A.

description: This is a great local place for take out or casual dine in.  The shaking filet mignon is great and the vietnamese crepe appetizer is also great.  We also like the garlic noodles.  This place is great and not too expensive.
author: B K.

description:
well
i should have know better
no asians eating in an asian restaurant , = lackluster food
soup made with instant broth, tasteless dipping sauces,
poor quality every thing , just bad .
any dive could do better
i know why I've never gone and wont return
fine for a tourist  but not me
author: james o.

description: Great food, warm service and excellent value! The flavors are fresh, the food delicious and very filling. When it's chilly and you are in the mood for something simple and hearty, the pho can't be beat - the broth is clean yet flavorful - and all the accompaniments are fresh. On those warm days (or if you're wanting something a bit on the lighter side), order yourself a "Bun" (Noodle) Salad with the combo of grilled lemongrass pork and imperial rolls. My favorite appetizers are the Imperial Rolls (the best I've ever had), Vietnamese Crepe, the 'fresh' Spring Rolls. If you are lucky enough to have friends who are into 'family-style' sharing, you must get the Shaking Beef, Crispy Chicken, Pan-fried Pork Chops, Grilled Fish with Dill (Cha Ca). When it's crab season, I always order the Pan-fried Crab and the very tasty Garlic Noodles...I'm happy to share the noodles but no one gets the crab...it's too good to share! The prices are reasonable and even it's not as upscale and trendy decor-wise as some of it's brethren, I chose Aux Delices every time. The Ngyuen Family is so welcoming and accomodating, they make you feel a part of their family so much so I chose to celebrate my birthdays with them and my friends. Some of my friends are 'finicky eaters' and will make specials trips into the City just for Aux Delices so thank goodness we've found a great 'compromise' when it comes to reasonably priced healthy food.
author: Jeannie K.

description: I seem to remember liking the pho here.  It doesn't seem like a truly authentic vietnamese restaurant (e.g. this place was actually clean, you didn't stick to the seats, and they didn't have 89 variations of pho), but it was fine.  And I think the restaurant was only about 50% full, 8PM on Saturday, so seating shouldn't be a problem.
author: Bill B.

description: The best French-Vietnamese on the West Coast!!  I love everything on the menu and the service is spectacular.   I always get the imperial rolls and clay pot salmon. The environment makes you feel right at home and it is nestled in a quiet spot on Polk Street.  I always know I will walk away with a satisfied stomach of tasty food.
author: Keith M.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood restaurants.  We go there almost weekly for an affordable and really delicious meal.  The menu is reasonably priced, with lots of variety.  I rarely get beyond the barbequed chicken, though.  It rocks.  On a strange note, their rice also is always really tasty.  I don't know what they do to it, but their plain white rice could be a meal in itself.  Aux Delices is a white table cloth place, but at the same time it has a very relaxed vibe.  The staff and owners are really, really great, too--friendly neighborhood folks who seem to enjoy making the experience nice for their guests.
author: Dave B.

description: Aux Delices is an outstanding restaurant.  The food is delicious and prepared to perfection.  It is family owned, the chief is the owner, each meal is prepared with the freshest vegetables, fish, meats possible. The diners can ask for dishes to be mild to spicey . There is a large variety of offerings and prices are very affordable. We would give Aux Delices our highest recommendation.  We eat there approximately every 4 to 6 weeks when we are in San Francisco.
author: Melinda H.

description: Great vietnamese food ! Clean and fresh, not your average dirty joint. I am a local to Russian Hill area and eat here multiple times per week.
author: Derek D.

description: I really like this place, though I've only eaten the appetizers. The spring rolls are great; they taste incredibly fresh. The pho here isn't the best I've had, but it does it's work.  The staff is really helpful and they get 'to go' orders out the door quickly. Cost is about average for this sort of restaurant; It would be a really pleasant place to take someone for dinner if you were not interested in spending a lot of money.
author: Vivek T.

description: I live in the neighborhood and work in the tenderloin so Vietnamese is a staple cuisine. As a vegetarian this is hands down the best place. The spicy soup, crepe, garlic noodles, and tofu noodle salad are the best. My husband loves the duck and every chicken dish. Yah there are a lot of good Vietnamese restaurants but the food is top quality here. We go in, or get take out, once a week. We even had our wedding rehearsal dinner here - it's really that good.
author: Dierdre M.

description: Hey ya'll.   I am beyond blessed to be able to live in this sweet city for only a short time each Summer.  There are so many- TOO many places to go if you live here full-time, and since I'm just part-time, I am always looking for the best of the best. That doesn't mean the most pricey or the most trendy, just the most delicious.  I could eat Vietnamese food 4 or 5 times a week and have tried several options here. However, the one place I find myself thinking about when I get back home is Aux Delices. Translated, it means "to joy", and their food does bring my palate joy. It is clean VIetnamese food, with a French touch-not heavy or sauced to death, but finished nicely. Their #54- a grilled fish dish with dill and shallot hits the PERFECT note. It  comes with fresh herbs and lettuce and vermicelli noodles on the side and you can ask for  the rice wrappers on the side. The traditional method of eatng this dish is to wet the wrappers and then roll a small amount of the deliciousness  up like a spring roll. (I am still working on my technique). Or you can  just ask for rice and not wrappers. Either way, you get the pleasure of a light, and flavorful VIetnamese dinner. This place is family-owned and operated and they are the warmest and friendliest people you could ever hope to meet. The service is spot-on and the prices are more than reasonable-especially for the Polk Street setting, where some places think quite alot of themselves.  There is no bar to sit or eat at, so it's just straight to your table, unless there is a wait (and there is on the weekends).The decor is warm and everything  else I have eaten here is very, very good. I highly recommend Aux Delices for lunch or dinner.
author: Peyton M.

description: Bummer... these guys actually have great food, BUT.... I just tried to place a delivery order and the guy acted like I was asking for the HUGEST favor.  I am maybe 11 blocks away?!  They have delivered to me on numerous occasions and never had a problem before.  It's a TUESDAY and the guy said they weren't even busy, however.... he "guessed he could do it for me IF I spent $25 (as opposed to their $20 minimum for delivery).  I reached $23.86 and the guy acted like he was going to do it for me but it was going to be "suuuuch a big favor."  Give me a break.... seriously, a Tuesday night?! and this is the kind of customer service given!  Too many other great restaurants willing to deliver without feeling like you have to give away your first born!  They guy answering the phone needs to learn better customer service!  I've given these guys rave reviews to many friends.... and this is what I got.  Very disappointing.  Again... good food, VERYPOOR  service.
author: h s.

description: I do not live in this area of California. I was in town visiting a friend. I was staying on the other side of town and on my last night she asked if I wanted to go to this place. She said it was a little out of the way but was worth it. So, we hopped on MUNI and arrived early enough to get a nice window table. This was the best Vietnamese food I have ever tasted, and I feel like I've had some really great Vietnamese. I ordered a Vegetarian soup that had Tamarind in it, it was spicy and sweet, perfectly seasoned. Very refreshing. I then ordered Ginger-Lemongrass Chicken and Brown Rice. All of it was excellent. I'm someone who usually takes leftovers home, but I ate every last bit of this meal. It was not greasy or oily either. The ingredients all seemed fresh and of good quality. I have given it four stars only because I have not been here more than the one time and don't feel that I can give a place five stars until I've ordered more things off the menu. I will definitely come back here next time I am in the bay area.
author: Brian E.
